        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in" align="center"><a name="PAGENUM"><font color="#000000" size="2" face="Times New Roman">1</font></a></p>

            <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 12pt" align="center"><b>ALANCO TECHNOLOGIES, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</b></p>
        </div>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; FONT-FAMILY: 'COURIER NEW'; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"><i><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Except for historical information, the statements contained herein are forward-looking statements made pursuant to the safe harbor provisions of the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995</font></i><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">.

        &ldquo;</font></i><i><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">anticipate,&rdquo; &ldquo;intend</font></i><i><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">,&rdquo; &rdquo;should,&rdquo; &ldquo;plan,&rdquo; &ldquo;could,&rdquo; &ldquo;target,&rdquo; &ldquo;potential,&rdquo; &ldquo;is likely,&rdquo; &ldquo;will,&rdquo; &ldquo;expect&rdquo; and similar expressions, as they relate to the Company are intended to identify forward-looking statements within the meaning of the &ldquo;safe
        harbor&rdquo; provisions of Section 27A of the Securities Act of 1933, as amended and Section 21E of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended. </font></i><i><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">From time to time, the Company may publish or otherwise make available forward-looking statements of this nature. All such forward-looking statements are based on the expectations of management when made and are subject to, and are qualified by, risks and uncertainties that could
        cause actual results to differ materially from those expressed or implied by those statements. These risks and uncertainties include, but are not limited to, the following factors, among others, that could affect the outcome of the Company's forward-looking statements: general economic and market conditions; reduced demand for information technology equipment; competitive pricing and difficulty managing product costs; development of new technologies which make the Company's products
        obsolete; rapid industry changes; failure by the Company's suppliers to meet quality or delivery requirements; the inability to attract, hire and retain key personnel; failure of an acquired business to further the Company's strategies; the difficulty of integrating an acquired business; undetected problems in the Company's products; the failure of the Company's intellectual property to be adequately protected; unforeseen litigation; unfavorable result of current pending litigation; the
        ability to maintain sufficient liquidity in order to support operations; the ability to maintain satisfactory relationships with lenders and to remain in compliance with financial loan covenants and other requirements under current banking agreements; the ability to maintain satisfactory relationships with suppliers; federal and/or state regulatory and legislative actions; customer preferences and spending patterns; the ability to implement or adjust to new technologies and the ability
        to secure and maintain key contracts and relationships.</font></i><i><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">New risk factors emerge from time to time and it is not possible to </font></i><i><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">accurately </font></i><i><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">predict all such risk factors, nor can we assess the impact of all such risk factors on our business or the extent to which any risk factor, or combination of risk factors, may

        events, changed circumstances or any other reason after the date of this Annual Report on Form 10-K. </font></i></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"><b><u><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">PART </font></u></b><b><u><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">I</font></u></b></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"><b>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</b></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">ITEM 1. BUSINESS<br>
        &nbsp; <br>
        GENERAL DEVELOPMENT OF BUSINESS </font></b></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Alanco Technologies, Inc. was incorporated in 1969 under the laws of the State of Arizona. Unless otherwise noted, the "Company" or &ldquo;Alanco&rdquo; refers to Alanco Technologies, Inc. and its wholly owned subsidiaries. Alanco (Nasdaq: ALAN) is a provider of advanced information technology solutions with the Company&rsquo;s
        operations for fiscal</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">year</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">ended</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">June 30, 2009</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">diversified into two reporting business segments including: (i) RFID Technology &ndash; incorporating design, production, marketing and distribution of RFID (Radio Frequency Identification) tracking technology, and (ii) Wireless Asset
        Management &ndash; incorporating the design, production, marketing, distribution and monitoring of wireless asset</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">management products, primarily for the transportation industry.</font></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The Company acquired its RFID (Radio Frequency Identification) tracking technology known as the TSI PRISM system in May 2002 through the acquisition of the operations of Technology Systems International, Inc., a Nevada corporation (&ldquo;TSIN&rdquo;). The June 30, 2006</font>
        <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">acquisition of StarTrak Systems, LLC (&ldquo;StarTrak&rdquo;), a Delaware LLC located in Morris Plains, New Jersey, added Wireless Asset Management, an additional reporting business segment described as a provider of wireless</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">cellular and GPS tracking and monitoring services, which are offered on a monthly subscription basis to various industry segments. The company&rsquo;s primary focus is
        currently the</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">refrigerated or &ldquo;Reefer&rdquo; segment of the transport industry, providing the dominant share of all wireless tracking, monitoring and control services to this market segment.</font></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">At June 30, 2008 the Company reported a third business segment,</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Data Storage &ndash; incorporating the manufacturing, marketing and distribution of data storage products. During the quarter ended March 31, 2009, the Company implemented a plan to divest the Data Storage segment
        and reinvest the proceeds into the Company&rsquo;s Wireless Asset Management and RFID Technology segments. As reported in the attached financial statements contained in Item 8 of this&nbsp;Form 10-K, at&nbsp;June 30, 2009 and 2008, the &ldquo;Assets Held for Sale&rdquo; and &ldquo;Liabilities Related to Assets Held for Sale&rdquo; consisted of the Data Storage segment asset and liabilities. Operating results for the Data Storage segment for the fiscal years ended June 30, 2009 and 2008
        are presented as Loss from Discontinued Operations. </font></p>

        <p></p>

        <div style="MARGIN-TOP: 12pt" title="PAGENUM" align="center">
            <a name="PAGENUM"><font color="#000000" size="2" face="Times New Roman">2</font></a>
        </div>

        <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 1px; FONT-SIZE: 1pt" title="EE+ Page Break">
            <hr width="100%" noshade>
        </div>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="center"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="3">ALANCO TECHNOLOGIES, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</font></b></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify">&nbsp;</p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">RECENT BUSINESS DEVELOPMENTS</font></b></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The Company was</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">notified by Nasdaq on September 15, 2009</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">that the Company failed to comply with the minimum bid price of $1.00 per share requirement for
        continued listing as set forth in NASDAQ Marketplace Rule 4310 (c) (4) (the &ldquo;Rule&rdquo;). Therefore in accordance with the Rule, the Company will be provided 180 calendar days or until March 15, 2010, to regain compliance. If the bid price of the Company&rsquo;s common stock closes at $1.00 per share or more for a minimum of 10 consecutive trading days, NASDAQ Staff will provide written notification that&nbsp;the Company complies with the rule. If compliance with</font>
        <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">this Rule cannot be demonstrated by March 15, 2010, Staff will determine whether the Company meets the NASDAQ Smallcap Market initial listing criteria as set forth in Marketplace Rule 4310 (c), except for the bid price requirement. If it meets the initial listing criteria, Staff will notify the Company that it has been granted an additional 180 calendar days to meet the $1.00 minimum bid price requirement. If the Company is not eligible for
        an additional compliance period, Staff will provide written notification that the Company&rsquo;s securities will be delisted. At that time, the Company may appeal Staff&rsquo;s determination to delist it securities to a Listing Qualification Panel.</font></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On September 15, 2009</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">the Company announced that it had completed a</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">financing with several independent accredited investors. The financing was comprised
        of the sale of 135,000 shares of convertible Series E</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Preferred Stock.</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The proceeds received by the Company from the offering were</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">$541,000, net of approximately $62,000</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">in related expenses. The Series E shares accrue a 5% cash dividend and are convertible into twelve (12) shares of
        the Company&rsquo;s Class A Common Stock. The Powers, Preferences, Rights and Limitations of the Series E Preferred Stock were included as attachments to an 8-K filed September 17, 2009. See Shareholders&rsquo; Equity footnote to the Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements for the fiscal year ended June 30, 2009 contained in Item 8 of this 10-K for additional&nbsp;discussion of the Series E Preferred Stock. </font></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The Company negotiated and executed a $1 million Amended and Restated Convertible Term Note</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">during September 2009, reducing the amount of the payments initially due and modifying the terms under which the
        balance of the note may be converted into common stock. The form of the Amended and Restated Convertible Term Note was included as an attachment to an 8-K filed on September 11, 2009. See Subsequent Events footnote to the June</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">30, 2009 consolidated financial statements contained in Item 8 of this 10-K&nbsp;for additional discussion on the amendment to the Convertible Term Note. </font></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The Company&rsquo;s subsidiary, StarTrak Systems, LLC, announced on July 7, 2009</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">that during the quarter ended June 30, 2009 it had added 18 new fleet customers that collectively operate over 3,000 refrigerated
        trucks and trailers. More than 125 refrigerated transport customers now subscribe to StarTrak&rsquo;s comprehensive reefer monitoring and management services. <br>
        &nbsp; </font></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">DESCRIPTION OF BUSINESS </font></b></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"><b><u><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">RFID TECHNOLOGY SEGMENT</font></u></b></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The Company acquired</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">the operations</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">of Technology Systems International, Inc., a Nevada Corporation (&ldquo;TSIN&rdquo;)</font>
        <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">in the fiscal year ended June 30, 2002. The technology consisted of the proprietary TSI PRISM&trade;</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">wireless 915</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">MHz RFID tracking capabilities</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">utilized primarily in correctional facilities, security management and personnel monitoring. The acquisition was effected through a wholly owned
        subsidiary, Technology Systems International, Inc., an Arizona corporation,</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">by the issuance of Alanco Class A Common Stock to purchase TSIN&rsquo;s assets and assumption of specific liabilities of TSIN. During the fiscal year</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">2005, the Company changed the name of Technology Systems</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">International, Inc. to Alanco/TSI PRISM, Inc.
        (&ldquo;ATSI&rdquo;).</font></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">In March 2005, Alanco entered into a technology license agreement (&ldquo;License&rdquo;) with a developer of RFID real-time location services technology utilizing 2.4 GHz wireless networking standards. The License currently grants to Alanco a</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">five-year worldwide license for
        the corrections market, to acquire, modify or combine the 2.4 GHz technology with Alanco&rsquo;s 915</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">MHz TSI PRISM technology. The Company believes the 2.4 GHz technology has certain application advantages over the 915</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">MHz technology in international markets and in some segments of the U.S. corrections market. </font></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Marketing</font></b> <b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">- </font></b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">ATSI</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">markets both its TSI PRISM&trade;</font>
        <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">915 MHz and 2.4 GHz RFID tracking systems</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">in the United States through the Company&rsquo;s</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">direct sales representatives</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and strategic partnerships. The primary focus of the marketing effort has been directed at the domestic state and federal correctional facilities and county jail markets.
        Internationally, ATSI is providing transmitter technology for projects in the corrections market in Europe and Australia. </font></p>

        <p></p>

        <div style="MARGIN-TOP: 12pt" title="PAGENUM" align="center">
            <a name="PAGENUM"><font color="#000000" size="2" face="Times New Roman">3</font></a>
        </div>

        <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 1px; FONT-SIZE: 1pt" title="EE+ Page Break">
            <hr width="100%" noshade>
        </div>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><strong><font size="3">ALANCO TECHNOLOGIES, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</font></strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </font></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify">&nbsp;</p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; During the quarter ended June 30, 2009, the Company announced that it had entered into international distribution, licensing and manufacturing agreements with G4S Justice Services Inc. (G4S). Under terms of the international distributing agreement, G4S has been granted
        exclusive distribution and licensing rights for the TSI system outside the continental U.S. Within the continental U.S., G4S will participate with TSI on certain major new market opportunities where the combined businesses can add value to the customer. G4S is the world&rsquo;s leading international security solutions group, which specializes in outsourced business processes in sectors where security and safety risks are considered a strategic threat. Listed on the London Stock
        Exchange, G4S 2008 consolidated revenues were approximately $8 billion USD. G4S has in excess of 585,000 employees with operations in over 110 countries. </font></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Raw Materials</font></b> <b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">- </font></b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The RFID Technology segment utilizes various domestic subcontractors and product suppliers for materials and parts used to manufacture and install its products. Due to the limited number of
        system</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">installations</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and product suppliers,</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">approximately</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">64% of the those purchases for fiscal year ended June 30, 2009</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">were made from three vendors, including 22% from the licensor</font>
        <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">of the 2.4 GHz technology, 28% from an electronics supplier and 13.7% from a metal fabricator.</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">During the fiscal year ended June 30, 2008, 78% of&nbsp;purchases were made from the licensor of the 2.4 GHz technology. </font></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The Company anticipates continued concentration of vendor purchases; however, additional</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">electric parts and metal fabricator suppliers are readily available at competitive pricing levels. The Company does not foresee any future significant shortages or substantial price
        increases that cannot be recovered from its customers. </font></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Competitive Conditions</font></b> <b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">&ndash;</font></b> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">We believe</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">the TSI PRISM&trade;</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">system is the only known wireless RFID
        continuous real-time tracking technology currently available to the correctional facilities market. There are other companies attempting to introduce area location and monitoring technologies in the correctional facilities market, offering an area or zone detection system. However, at this time those</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">technologies are not capable of providing continuous real-time tracking</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">for more than
        a limited number of inmates or staff in a concentrated area.</font></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Employees</font></b> <b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">- </font></b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The Company&rsquo;s RFID tracking segment employed</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">sixteen full-time employees at both June 30, 2009</font>
        <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and 2008.</font></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Seasonality of Business</font></b> <b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">-</font></b> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Location and tracking products have minimal seasonality. However, many of the products in this segment are marketed to state and federal government customers that are affected by annual
        budget schedules and economic conditions.</font></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Dependence Upon Key Customers</font></b> <b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">- </font></b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The RFID Technology segment continues in an early stage of commercial market development</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">in the United States. Targeted
        customers operate the majority of the prison facilities</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">in the United States and include the 50 state governments, numerous county governments</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and the federal government. During the twelve months ended June 30, 2009, three</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">customers individually accounted for more than 10% of the segment&rsquo;s fiscal year 2009 revenues for a total
        of 78% of total segment revenues and 94.1% of total segment accounts receivable. During fiscal year</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">2008,</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">five customers individually accounted for more than 10% of&nbsp;segment revenues for a total of 76% of total segment revenues and 72% of total segment accounts receivable.</font></p>

        <p></p>
        <font size="2"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Backlog Orders</font></b> <b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">- </font></b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The Company operates using system order contracts that it considers to be firm and non-cancelable</font> and extended maintenance contracts not longer than twelve months. Under this method, the Company had an order backlog
        <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">as of June 30, 2009</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">of approximately $700,000. That backlog does not consider the estimated revenue from 19 U.S. Immigration Detention Facilities, previously announced by the Company, which are currently being designed and planned under an award to Northrop Grumman Corporation to provide RFID inmate tracking systems. At June 30, 2008, the backlog order value was approximately $5.5
        million.</font></font>

        <p></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Research &amp; Development</font></b> <b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">- </font></b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The Company estimated that the ATSI</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">operations</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">spent approximately $400,000 in
        research and development expenditures, recorded as selling, general and administrative expense, during fiscal years 2009</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and 2008, respectively.</font></p>

        <p></p>

        <div style="MARGIN-TOP: 12pt" title="PAGENUM" align="center">
            <a name="PAGENUM"><font color="#000000" size="2" face="Times New Roman">4</font></a>
        </div>

        <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 1px; FONT-SIZE: 1pt" title="EE+ Page Break">
            <hr width="100%" noshade>
        </div>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="center"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><strong><font size="3">ALANCO TECHNOLOGIES, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</font></strong></font></font></b></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify">&nbsp;</p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"><b><u>WIRELESS ASSET MANAGEMENT<br>
        </u></b></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The Company&rsquo;s Wireless Asset Management business segment was established by the acquisition, effective June 30, 2006, of StarTrak Systems, LLC (&ldquo;StarTrak&rdquo;), a privately held Delaware LLC located in Morris Plains, New Jersey. StarTrak is a leading provider of wireless cellular, satellite and GPS tracking and
        monitoring services which are offered on a monthly subscription basis to various transportation industry segments. The Company&rsquo;s primary focus is currently the refrigerated or &ldquo;Reefer&rdquo; segment of the transport industry. StarTrak provides the dominant share of all wireless tracking, monitoring and control services to this market segment. </font></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Marketing &ndash; </font></b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">StarTrak markets its wireless tracking and subscription data services in the United States, both through dealers and the Company&rsquo;s direct sales representatives. The primary focus of the marketing effort has been directed at the domestic
        refrigerated transport market and the reefer equipment providers. The Company is also expanding international sales opportunities</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and expects that segment to grow as well.</font></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Raw Materials &ndash; </font></b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The Wireless Asset Management segment utilizes various domestic suppliers</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">for materials, parts</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and assembly used to manufacture its hardware
        products</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and a number of suppliers for its air time purchases, both cellular and satellite, required to provide its data services. For fiscal year ended June 30, 2009, one provider of parts and assembly accounted</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">for 21% of total</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">segment purchases</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and one vendor who provides
        satellite air time accounted</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">for 27% of total purchases. During fiscal 2008, one provider of parts and assembly accounted for 24% of total</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">purchases and one vendor who provides satellite air time accounted for 27% of total purchases.</font></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The Company anticipates the Wireless Asset Management segment will utilize various domestic subcontractors in the future for materials and parts used to manufacture its products; however, certain vendors may represent more than 10% of total purchases. Additional suppliers are generally available at competitive pricing levels
        and we anticipate concentration of purchases will decrease as new products are introduced and volumes increase. The Company does not foresee any future significant shortages or substantial price increases that cannot be recovered from its customers. </font></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Competitive Conditions - </font></b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">StarTrak</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">is the dominant provider of wireless tracking and monitoring services that offers a subscription program targeted to the refrigerated or &ldquo;Reefer&rdquo; segment of the transport
        industry. There are other companies marketing</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">tracking services to the general transport industry; however, to our knowledge, none have the capability of providing integration with the major manufacturers&rsquo; &ldquo;Reefer&rdquo; electronic systems that allows for the monitoring of various sensor data for control of such equipment on a real-time basis. </font></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Employees - </font></b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The Company&rsquo;s Wireless Asset Management segment employed thirty-six</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">full-time and part-time employees as of June 30, 2009</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and 2008,
        respectively.</font></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Seasonality of Business -</font></b> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Location and tracking products have minimal seasonality. However, many of the products in this segment are marketed to commercial customers that are affected by annual budget schedules and economic conditions. Further, high asset utilization
        during the summer months can cause some seasonal effects on deployment of units.</font></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Dependence Upon Key Customers &ndash; </font></b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">In the Wireless Asset Management segment, three customers individually accounted for a total of 44.9% of fiscal year 2009 revenues and 52.3% of total segment accounts receivable.&nbsp; During fiscal year 2008, the same three
        customers accounted for 55.8% of total segment revenues and 58.8% of total segment accounts receivable.</font></p>

        <p></p>
        <font size="2"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Backlog Orders - </font></b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The Company operates using order contracts that it considers to be firm and non-cancelable. Under this method, the Company had unfulfilled contracts as of June 30, 2009 and 2008</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">of approximately $8.5</font>
        <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and $8</font> </font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2">million, respectively.</font> </font>

        <p></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Research &amp; Development - </font></b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The Company estimates it spent approximately $300,000 and $250,000</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">in research and development expenditures, recorded as selling, general and administrative expense, in</font>
        <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">fiscal years 2009</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and 2008, respectively.</font></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify">&nbsp;</p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"><b><u><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">COMPUTER DATA STORAGE SEGMENT</font></u></b></p>

        <p></p>

        <div style="MARGIN-TOP: 12pt" title="PAGENUM" align="center">
            &nbsp;
        </div>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">At June 30, 2008 the Company reported a third business segment,</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Data Storage &ndash; incorporating the manufacturing, marketing and distribution of data storage products. During the quarter ended March 31,
        2009, the Company implemented a plan to divest the Data Storage segment and reinvest the proceeds into the Company&rsquo;s Wireless Asset Management and RFID Technology segments. At June 30, 2009 and 2008, the &ldquo;Assets Held for Sale&rdquo; and &ldquo;Liabilities Related to Assets Held for Sale&rdquo; consisted of the Data Storage segment's asset and liabilities. Operating results for the Data Storage segment for the fiscal years ended June 30, 2009 and 2008 are presented as Loss
        from Discontinued Operations. </font></p>

        <p></p>

        <div style="MARGIN-TOP: 12pt" title="PAGENUM" align="center">
            <font color="#000000" size="2" face="Times New Roman">5</font>
        </div>

        <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 1px; FONT-SIZE: 1pt" title="EE+ Page Break">
            <hr width="100%" noshade>
        </div>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="3"><strong>ALANCO TECHNOLOGIES, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</strong></font></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="center">&nbsp;</p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Data Storage Segment represents</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">the operations of Excel/Meridian Data, Inc. (&ldquo;Excel&rdquo;).</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Excel,</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">a Dallas, Texas-based provider of data storage networking products
        and services,</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">is a manufacturer and marketer of data storage networking products and is recognized as a leading provider of optical storage devices, such as CD/DVD-ROM servers. Excel also markets a Network Attached Storage (&ldquo;NAS&rdquo;) product line and other storage products incorporating state-of-the-art software technology.</font></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Marketing</font></b> <b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">- </font></b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Excel markets optical storage and NAS products, primarily in the United States, through national advertising, telemarketing and Company sales representatives. </font></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Raw Materials</font></b> <b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">&ndash;</font></b> <a name="OLE_LINK1"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">During fiscal year</font></a>s 2009 <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">four (4) suppliers accounted for more than 10% of purchases totaling 72% of total
        segment purchases.&nbsp;&nbsp;During fiscal year 2008, two suppliers accounted for more than 66%&nbsp;of material and parts purchases. One supplier accounted for 34% and a second supplier accounted for 32% of purchases. The Company anticipates continued concentration of vendor purchases; however, additional suppliers are available at competitive pricing levels. The Company does not foresee any future significant shortages or substantial price increases that cannot be recovered from its
        customers.</font></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Competitive Conditions</font></b> <b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">- </font></b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">There are numerous competitors in the Computer Data Storage market, with no company dominating the market. Excel competes with many
        established companies in the general storage market and many of these companies may have substantially greater financial, marketing and technological resources, larger distribution capabilities, earlier access to customers and more opportunities to address customers' various information storage requirements than the Company. The Company also competes with many smaller, less established companies in specific storage product segments. Some of these companies may have earlier access to new
        technologies or products than the Company. The announcement or introduction of new products and/or implementation of effective marketing strategies by its competitors</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">may have a materially adverse effect on the Company's business.</font></font></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Employees</font></b> <b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">- </font></b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">As of June 30, 2009,</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">the Company&rsquo;s computer data storage business employed eight
        full-time</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">employees, compared to sixteen full-time employees as of June 30, 2008.</font></font></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Seasonality of Business</font></b> <b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">- </font></b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Computer data storage products have minimal seasonality. However, many of the products in this segment are marketed to business customers,
        which in some cases can be significantly affected by budget restraints and economic conditions.</font></font></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Dependence Upon Key Customers</font></b> <b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">- </font></b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">During fiscal year 2009</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">one customer accounted for 11.7% of revenues and during
        fiscal year 2008</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">one customer accounted for 10.5% of revenues.</font></font></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Backlog Orders</font></b> <b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">- </font></b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The Company operates using customer purchase orders that in some cases may not be considered firm and non-cancelable. Methods of defining a firm
        "Backlog Order" are being evaluated, and if the Company utilizes that information in evaluating sales activity, the information will be reported.</font></font></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Research &amp; Development</font></b> <b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">- </font></b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The Company estimates it spent approximately $75,000 and $100,000 in research and development expenditures, recorded as selling, general
        and administrative expense, for fiscal years 2009</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and 2008, respectively.</font></font></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">ITEM </font></b><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">1A. RISK FACTORS</font></b></font></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 12pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">An investment in Alanco involves a high degree of risk. In addition to the other information included in this Form 10-K, you should carefully consider the following risk factors in determining whether or not to purchase shares of Alanco Class A Common Stock. These matters should be
        considered in conjunction with the other information included or incorporated by reference in this filing. This Form 10-K</font> <font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">contains statements which constitute forward-looking statements within the meaning of the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995. These statements appear in a number of places and include statements regarding the intent, belief or current expectations of our management, directors or officers primarily
        with respect to our future operating performance. Prospective purchasers of our securities are cautioned that these forward-looking statements are not guarantees of future performance and involve risks and uncertainties. Actual results may differ materially from those in the forward-looking statements as a result of various factors. The information set out below, identifies important factors that could cause such differences. See &ldquo;Safe Harbor Statements Under the Private
        Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995.&rdquo;<br>
        &nbsp; </font></font></p>

        <div style="MARGIN-TOP: 12pt" title="PAGENUM" align="center">
            <a name="PAGENUM"><font color="#000000" size="2" face="Times New Roman">6</font></a>
        </div>

        <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 1px; FONT-SIZE: 1pt" title="EE+ Page Break">
            <hr width="100%" noshade>
        </div>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><strong><font size="3">ALANCO TECHNOLOGIES, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</font></strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </font></font></b></font></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify">&nbsp;</p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in" align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><i><u><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">We may not be able to reach the sales goals anticipated from the StarTrak Systems acquisition</font></u></i></b><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">. We acquired the operations of StarTrak Systems, LLC (&ldquo;StarTrak&rdquo;) effective June 30, 2006. StarTrak is a leading provider
        of wireless tracking and subscription data services to the transportation industry, with a focus upon the refrigerated or &ldquo;Reefer&rdquo; segment of the transport industry. StarTrak provides wireless (including GPS, cellular and radio) tracking, monitoring and control services to this market. We are anticipating significant revenue growth from sales of StarTrak products in the transportation market.&nbsp;There is no certainty that we will be able to capture the required market
        share for StarTrak to achieve its anticipated financial success. The StarTrak system is currently being marketed to the transportation market as a tool to increase efficiency and reduce costs of the refrigerated supply chain by wireless monitoring and control of critical Reefer data, including GPS location, cargo temperatures and Reefer fuel levels. Although StarTrak is the dominant provider for tracking, management and control services of the refrigeration transport market and is
        currently the only tracking system, to the best of our knowledge, which is able to provide direct interaction with the customer allowing for remote adjustments of variables controlled by the unit, there are other tracking/monitoring systems being marketed to the refrigerated transport industry. There is no certainty that the transportation industry will adopt this technology broadly enough for us to reach our marketing projections.</font></font></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in" align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><i><u><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The loss of key StarTrak personnel would have a negative impact on our StarTrak business and technology development</font></u></i></b><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">. Our StarTrak technology is reliant on key personnel who developed and understand the technology. We have
        short-term contracts with some key personnel, but have no assurance that such personnel will remain with the Company on a long-term basis. The loss of the services of those key technology personnel could have an adverse effect on the business, operating results and financial condition of our company.<br>
        &nbsp; </font></font></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in" align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><i><u><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">We may continue to experience lower than anticipated sales in our TSI PRISM division</font></u></i></b><i><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">.</font></i> <font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">We acquired the business and assets of Technology Systems International, Inc.
        (&ldquo;TSI&rdquo;) effective June 2002, creating the Company&rsquo;s RFID Technology segment. During fiscal 2005, we changed the name of Technology Systems International, Inc. to Alanco/TSI PRISM, Inc. (&ldquo;ATSI&rdquo;). We had anticipated significant revenue growth from sales of the TSI PRISM tracking system in the corrections market in prior years which was not realized. We continue to anticipate future significant revenue growth from sales of the TSI PRISM tracking system;
        however, there is no certainty that we will be able to capture the required market share for ATSI to achieve its anticipated financial success. The TSI PRISM system is currently being marketed to the corrections market as a prison and jail management tool and officer safety system. Although there are other inmate and officer monitoring systems being marketed to the corrections industry, the TSI PRISM system is currently the only system, to the best of our knowledge, which is able to
        continuously (every two seconds) monitor the location of both officers and prisoners, both inside and outside of buildings. There is no certainty that the corrections industry will adopt this technology broadly enough for us to reach our marketing projections.</font></font></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in" align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><i><u><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The loss of key ATSI personnel would have a negative impact on our ATSI business and technology development</font></u></i></b><i><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">. </font></i><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Our TSI PRISM technology is reliant on key personnel who
        developed and understand the technology. We have no employment contracts with any of our ATSI personnel. The loss of the services of those key technology personnel could have an adverse effect on the business, operating results and financial condition of our company, and our ability to continue to develop products economically and competitively.</font></font></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in" align="justify">&nbsp;</p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in" align="justify"><font size="2"><strong><em><u>We are subject to the budget constraints of the governmental agencies purchasing TSI PRISM systems, which could result in a significant decrease in our anticipated revenues.</u></em></strong>&nbsp; We cannot assure you that the governmental agencies we anticipate purchasing our TSI PRISM systems will have the necessary revenue to purchase the systems even
        though they may want to do so.&nbsp; The funds available to governmental agencies are subject to various economic and political influences.&nbsp; Even though the TSI PRISM system may be recommended for purchase by corrections facility managers, the governmental agency responsible for the facility may not have sufficient budget resources to purchase the system.</font></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in" align="justify">&nbsp;</p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in" align="justify"><font size="2"><strong><em><u>Worsening general economic conditions may negatively affect our potential customers' ability and willingness to purchase the products sold by our Company.</u></em></strong>&nbsp; Both our RFID Technology and our Data Storage segment rely on a strong economy to support technology spending by our customers.&nbsp; Our Data Storage segment sells network attached
        storage systems to mid-sized network users.&nbsp; Previous deterioration in general economic conditions resulted in reduced spending by our customers for technology in general, including the products sold by us.&nbsp; We have the ability to reduce overhead to assist in offsetting our reduced sales volume; however, if the economic conditions were to deteriorate, we could experience a material adverse impact on our business, operating results, and financial conditions.&nbsp; See previous
        section discussing the budget constraints of our RFID government customers.&nbsp; As some government funding is supplied by sales tax and income tax revenues, a reduction in economic activity reduces governmental revenues and the monies that can be budgeted for TSI PRISM systems.</font></p>

        <p></p>

        <div style="MARGIN-TOP: 12pt" title="PAGENUM" align="center">
            <a name="PAGENUM"><font color="#000000" size="2" face="Times New Roman">7</font></a>
        </div>

        <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 1px; FONT-SIZE: 1pt" title="EE+ Page Break">
            <hr width="100%" noshade>
        </div>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><strong><font size="3">ALANCO TECHNOLOGIES, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</font></strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </font></font></b></font></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify">&nbsp;</p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in" align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><i><u><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Acts of domestic terrorism and war have impacted general economic conditions and may impact the industry and our ability to operate profitably</font></u></i></b><i><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">.</font></i><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">On September 11, 2001,
        acts of terrorism occurred in New York City and Washington, D.C. On October 7, 2001, the United States launched military actions on Afghanistan, and in 2003 launched military attacks on Iraq with ongoing operations in both areas. As a result of those terrorist acts and military actions, there has been a disruption in general economic activity and a diversion of governmental funding to those endeavors that would otherwise have been available for the purchase of products and systems such
        as those sold by the Company. There may be other consequences resulting from those acts of terrorism, and any others which may occur in the future, including civil disturbance, war, riot, epidemics, public demonstration, explosion, freight embargoes, governmental action, governmental delay, restraint or inaction, quarantine restrictions, unavailability of capital, equipment, personnel, which we may not be able to anticipate. These terrorist acts and acts of war may continue to impact
        the economy, and in turn, reduce the demand for our products and services, which would harm our ability to make a profit. Also, as federal dollars are redirected to military efforts, they may not be available for the purchase of new federal prison monitoring systems from our ATSI subsidiary. </font></font></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in" align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><i><u><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Company may not have sufficient capital to meet its liquidity needs if we are not able to carry out our fiscal year 200</font></u></i></b><b><i><u><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">9</font></u></i></b> <b><i><u><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">operating plan;
        Uncertainty of proceeds and additional financing</font></u></i></b><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">. The Company incurred significant losses during fiscal year 2009 and fiscal year 2008</font> <font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">and has experienced significant losses in prior years. Although management cannot assure that future operations will be profitable or that additional debt and/or equity capital will be raised, we believe that, based on our fiscal
        2010</font> <font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">operating plan, cash flow</font> <font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">and additional funding sources</font> <font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">will be adequate to meet our anticipated future requirements for working capital expenditures, scheduled lease payments and scheduled payments of interest on our indebtedness. We will need to materially reduce expenses, or raise additional funds through public or
        private debt or equity financing, or both, if the revenue and cash flow elements of our 2010</font> <font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">operating plan are not met. If we need to seek additional financing to meet working capital requirements, there can be no assurance that additional financing will be available on terms acceptable to us, or at all. If adequate funds are not available or are not available on acceptable terms, our business, operating results, financial condition
        and ability to continue operations will be materially adversely affected. </font></font></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in" align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><i><u><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">If we raise additional funds through the sale of stock, our existing Alanco shareholders will experience dilution and may be subject to newly issued senior securities</font></u></i></b><i><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">.
        </font></i><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">If additional funds are raised through the issuance of equity securities, the percentage ownership of the then current shareholders of the Company will be reduced, and such equity securities may have rights, preferences or privileges senior to those of the holders of Class A Common Stock.</font></font></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in" align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><i><u><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Our StarTrak and ATSI intellectual property protection may not be sufficient to maintain the value of such property rights</font></u></i></b><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">. Our primary business strategy is to develop the StarTrak and ATSI business opportunities. The long-term
        success of this strategy depends in part upon the StarTrak and ATSI intellectual property acquired. Although we are not currently aware of any conflicting technology rights, third parties may hold United States or foreign patents which may be asserted in the future against the StarTrak and ATSI technology, and there is no assurance that any license that might be required under such patents could be obtained on commercially reasonable terms, or otherwise. Our competitors may also
        independently develop technologies that are substantially equivalent or superior to our technology. In addition, the laws of some foreign countries do not protect our proprietary rights to the same extent as the laws of the United States.</font></font></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in" align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><i><u><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Our efforts to prohibit others from infringing upon our StarTrak and ATSI intellectual property may not be adequate</font></u></i></b><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">. Despite our efforts to safeguard and maintain our proprietary rights both in the United States and abroad,
        there can be no assurance that we will be successful in doing so or that the steps taken by us in this regard will be adequate to deter infringement, misuse, misappropriation or independent third-party development of our technology or intellectual property rights or to prevent an unauthorized third party from copying or otherwise obtaining and using our products or technology. Litigation may also become necessary to defend or enforce our proprietary rights. Any of such events could have
        a negative impact on our competitive position in the markets we serve. </font></font></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><i><u><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The loss of key corporate or subsidiary executives would have a negative effect on our Company</font></u></i></b><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">. Our performance is substantially dependent on the services and performance of our executive officers and key employees. The loss of the services of
        any of our executive officers or key employees could have a material adverse effect on our business, operating results and financial condition due to their extensive industry specific knowledge and comprehensive operating plans for the Company. Our future success will depend on our ability to attract, integrate, motivate and retain qualified technical, sales, operations and managerial personnel. </font></font></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in">&nbsp;</p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in"></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in" align="center"></p>

        <div style="MARGIN-TOP: 12pt" title="PAGENUM" align="center">
            <a name="PAGENUM"><font color="#000000" size="2" face="Times New Roman">8</font></a>
        </div>

        <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 1px; FONT-SIZE: 1pt" title="EE+ Page Break">
            <div align="center">
                <hr width="100%" noshade>
            </div>
        </div>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><strong><font size="3">ALANCO TECHNOLOGIES, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</font></strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </font></font></b></font></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify">&nbsp;</p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in" align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><i><u><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Additional competitors to StarTrak may arise that could affect the future projected StarTrak business</font></u></i></b><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">. Although StarTrak currently is the dominant provider of tracking, management and control services of refrigeration transport
        Reefer units, it can be expected that if, and to the extent that, the demand for the StarTrak technology increases, the number of competitors will likely increase. Increasing competition could adversely affect the amount of new business we are able to attract, the rates we are able to charge for our services and/or products, or both.<br>
        &nbsp; </font></font></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in" align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><i><u><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Additional competitors to the TSI PRISM business may arise that could affect the future projected TSI PRISM business</font></u></i></b><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">. Although early in the market development cycle, the TSI PRISM business/technology has no current, identified
        direct competitors capable of the same performance levels as the TSI PRISM system. There are other companies attempting to introduce area location and monitoring technologies in the correctional facilities market who offer area or zone detection systems that are not capable of providing continuous real-time tracking at this time. However, it can be expected that if, and to the extent that, the demand for the ATSI technology increases, the number of competitors will likely increase, as
        will their capabilities. Increasing competition could adversely affect the amount of new business we are able to attract, the rates we are able to charge for our services and/or products, or both.</font></font></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in" align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><i><u><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">We may </font></u></i></b><b><i><u><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">not be able to sell </font></u></i></b><b><i><u><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">our Excel Meridian Data subsidiary</font></u></i></b><b><i><u><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">,
        reported as Assets held for sale at June 30, 2009.</font></u></i></b> <font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Because of the current economic downturn and Excel&rsquo;s lack of sustained profitability, we may be unable to sell Excel, or may be unable to sell Excel for a value equal to or greater than its carrying value as of June 30, 2009.</font></font></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in" align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><i><u><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">If Excel continues as a subsidiary, w</font></u></i></b><b><i><u><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">e may lack the capital for our Excel Meridian Data subsidiary to compete effectively in the data storage market</font></u></i></b><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">.
        Because we are significantly smaller than many of our competitors in the data storage business, we may lack the capital required to increase our market share. We operate in a very competitive environment, competing against numerous other companies, many of whom have greater financial resources and market position than we do.<br>
        &nbsp; </font></font></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in" align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><i><u><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">We may not be able</font></u></i></b> <b><i><u><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">to </font></u></i></b><b><i><u><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">maintain NASDAQ listing if we are unable to achieve a&nbsp;stock price above the minimum
        </font></u></i></b><b><i><u><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">$1.00 bid price per share</font></u></i></b><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">. Our Class A Common Stock currently trades on the NASDAQ Capital Market under the symbol &ldquo;ALAN.&rdquo; However, there can be no assurance that an active trading market in our Class A Common Stock will be available at any particular future time. </font></font></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; FONT-FAMILY: 'COURIER NEW'; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The Company was</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">notified by Nasdaq on September 15, 2009 that the Company failed to comply with the minimum bid price of $1.00 per share requirement for continued listing as set forth in NASDAQ Marketplace
        Rule 4310 (c) (4) (the &ldquo;Rule&rdquo;). Therefore in accordance with the Rule, the Company will be provided 180 calendar days or until March 15, 2010, to regain compliance. If the bid price of the Company&rsquo;s common stock closes at $1.00 per share or more for a minimum of 10 consecutive trading days, NASDAQ Staff will provide written notification that it complies with the rule. If compliance with this Rule cannot be demonstrated by March 15, 2010, Staff will determine whether
        the Company meets the NASDAQ Smallcap Market initial listing criteria as set forth in Marketplace Rule 4310 (c), except for the bid price requirement. If it meets the initial listing criteria, Staff will notify the Company that it has been granted an additional 180 calendar days to meet the $1.00 minimum bid price requirement. If the Company is not eligible for an additional compliance period, Staff will provide written notification that the Company&rsquo;s securities will be delisted.
        At that time, the Company may appeal Staff&rsquo;s determination to delist its securities to a Listing Qualification Panel.</font></font></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 12pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">There can be no assurance that the Company&rsquo;s stock will&nbsp;trade above the minimum NASDAQ $1.00 per share bid requirement, or that the company will meet, on March 15, 2010,</font> <font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Nasdaq</font>
        <font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Small cap Market initial listing criteria, except the minimum bid price requirement, as discussed above, or that</font> <font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">the Company will be able</font> <font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">to maintain listing requirements in the future, resulting in additional notifications</font> <font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">that delisting may occur.</font></font></p>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 12pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><i><u><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Company does not anticipate payment of dividends</font></u></i></b> <b><i><u><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">on Common Stock</font></u></i></b><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">. We do not anticipate that we will pay cash dividends on our Class
        A Common Stock in the foreseeable future. The payment of dividends by us will depend on our earnings, financial condition, and such other factors, as our Board of Directors may consider relevant. We currently plan to retain earnings to provide for the development of our business.</font></font></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 12pt" align="justify">&nbsp;</p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 12pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><i><u><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Our articles of incorporation and Arizona law may have the effect of making it more expensive or more difficult for a third party to acquire, or to acquire control of,
        us</font></u></i></b><i><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">.</font></i><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Our articles of incorporation make it possible for our Board of Directors to issue preferred stock with voting or other rights that could impede the success of any attempt to change control of us. Arizona law prohibits a publicly held Arizona corporation from engaging in certain business combinations with certain persons, who acquire our securities with the
        intent of engaging in a business combination, unless the proposed transaction is approved in a prescribed manner. This provision has the effect of discouraging transactions not approved by our Board of Directors as required by the statute which may discourage third parties from attempting to acquire us or to acquire control of us even if the attempt would result in a premium over market price for the shares of common stock held by our shareholders. <br>
        &nbsp; </font></font></p>

        <div style="MARGIN-TOP: 12pt" title="PAGENUM" align="center">
            <a name="PAGENUM"><font color="#000000" size="2" face="Times New Roman">9</font></a>
        </div>

        <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 1px; FONT-SIZE: 1pt" title="EE+ Page Break">
            <hr width="100%" noshade>
        </div>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><strong><font size="3">ALANCO TECHNOLOGIES, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</font></strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </font></font></b></font></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" align="justify">&nbsp;</p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 12pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><i><u><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Certain provisions in our Alanco shareholder rights plan may discourage a takeover attempt</font></u></i></b><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt">.We have implemented a shareholder rights plan which could make an unsolicited takeover of our company more difficult. As a result,
        shareholders holding a controlling block of shares may be deprived of the opportunity to sell their shares to potential acquirers at a premium over prevailing market prices. This potential inability to obtain a premium could reduce the market price of our common stock.</font><br>
        &nbsp; </font></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 12pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><i><u><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The market price of Alanco Class A Common Stock may fluctuate significantly in response to a number of factors, some of which are beyond our control</font></u></i></b><font style="COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">. These factors include:</font></font></p>
