        <p></p>

        <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</font></b></font></p>

        <p></p>

        <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; NATURE OF OPERATIONS AND SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING POLICIES</font></b></font></p>

        <p></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">N</font></b><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">ature of Operations</font></b> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">- Alanco Technologies, Inc.</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">was incorporated in Arizona in 1969.</font></font></font></p>
        </blockquote>

        <p></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Alanco Technologies, Inc. and subsidiaries&rsquo;</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">(the &ldquo;Company&rdquo;) business operations for the past several years have emphasized a plan to strategically position the Company as a provider of information technology</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">specializing in tracking and
            monitoring.</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The Company initiated its</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">strategic direction in fiscal year 2002 when it</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">acquired wireless tracking RFID (Radio Frequency Identification) technology designed to be used in the corrections market, through its acquisition of the operations of Technology Systems International, Inc., a Nevada corporation
            (&ldquo;TSIN&rdquo;). The Company expanded its footprint in wireless tracking and data services into wireless asset management for the refrigerated or &ldquo;Reefer&rdquo; market through the acquisition, effective June 30, 2006, of StarTrak Systems, LLC,</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">a Delaware corporation, (&ldquo;StarTrak&rdquo;),</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">a provider of GPS tracking and wireless data services for the Reefer segment
            of the transport industry.</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">In fiscal years</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">2009</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and 2008,</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">the Company had continued operations in the RFID Technology</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and Wireless Asset Management business segments. </font></font></font></p>
        </blockquote>

        <p></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Principles of Consolidation</font></b> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">- The consolidated financial statements for the years</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">ended June 30, 2009</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and 2008 include the accounts of Alanco Technologies, Inc. and its</font>
            <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">wholly-owned subsidiaries, Alanco/TSI PRISM, Inc.</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">(&ldquo;ATSI&rdquo;),</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Excel/Meridian Data, Inc.</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">(&ldquo;Excel&rdquo;), Fry Guy,</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Inc.</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">(&rdquo;Fry Guy&rdquo;)</font>
            <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">StarTrak Systems, LLC (&ldquo;StarTrak&rdquo;) (collectively, the &ldquo;Company&rdquo;). The operating results for Excel for both fiscal years 2009 and 2008 are presented as discontinued operations. All subsidiaries are Arizona</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">corporations, except Fry Guy, which is a Nevada corporation</font>
            <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and StarTrak Systems, LLC, which is a Delaware LLC. All significant intercompany accounts and transactions have been eliminated in consolidation.</font></font></font></p>
        </blockquote>

        <p></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Reclassifications </font></b><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">&ndash; </font></b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Certain balances have</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">been reclassified in the accompanying consolidated financial statements to conform to the current year presentation.</font></font></font></p>
        </blockquote>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 12pt" title="EE+ Page Footer" align="center">&nbsp;</p>
        <!-- PAGE BREAK  -->

        <div style="MARGIN-TOP: 12pt" title="PAGENUM" align="center">
            <a name="PAGENUM"><font color="#000000" size="2" face="Times New Roman">26</font></a>
        </div>

        <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 1px; FONT-SIZE: 1pt" title="EE+ Page Break">
            <hr>
        </div>

        <div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12pt" title="EE+ Page Header">
            <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 12pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b>ALANCO TECHNOLOGIES, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</b></font></p>
        </div>

        <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (continued)</font></b></font></p>

        <p></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Cash Equivalents</font></b> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">- The Company considers all highly liquid debt instruments with original maturities of three months or less to be cash equivalents.</font></font></font></p>
        </blockquote>

        <p></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Accounts Receivable Trade</font></b> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">- The Company provides for potentially uncollectible accounts receivable by use of the allowance method. An allowance for doubtful accounts is provided based upon a review of the individual accounts outstanding and the Company's prior history of uncollectible accounts.
            Provision for uncollectible accounts receivable amounted to approximately $235,200</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and $109,700</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">at June 30, 2009</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and 2008, respectively. The Company does not typically accrue interest or fees on past due amounts.</font></font></font></p>
        </blockquote>

        <p></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Inventories</font></b> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">- Inventories consist of materials and parts and finished goods.</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Inventories are stated at the lower of cost or market. Cost is calculated using the average-cost method for the Data Storage</font>
            <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and Wireless Asset Management segments and first-in, first-out (&ldquo;FIFO&rdquo;) for the RFID Technology</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">segment.</font></font></font></p>
        </blockquote>

        <p></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><strong>Prepaid Expenses and Other Assets -</strong> Included in prepaid expenses and other assets at June 30, 2009, are net deferred software development costs.&nbsp; During the fiscal year 2009, $400,000 of software development costs were deferred, $134,000 were expensed to cost of sales, RFID Technology segment, resulting in net deferred software costs at
            June 30, 2009 of $266,000.</font></font></font></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Property, Plant and Equipment</font></b> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">- Property, plant and equipment are stated at cost. Depreciation is computed over the estimated useful lives of the assets using the straight-line method, generally over a 3 to 10 year period. Leasehold improvements are amortized on the straight-line method over the lesser
            of the lease term or the useful life. Expenditures for ordinary maintenance and repairs are charged to expense as incurred. Betterments are capitalized as incurred. Upon retirement or disposal of assets, the cost and accumulated depreciation are eliminated from the account and any gain or loss is reflected in the statement of operations.</font></font></font></p>
        </blockquote>

        <p></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Fair Value of Financial Instruments</font></b> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">- The estimated fair values for financial instruments are determined at discrete points in time based on relevant market information. These estimates involve uncertainties and cannot be determined with precision. The carrying amounts of accounts receivable, notes
            receivable, accounts payable, accrued liabilities, and notes payable approximate fair value</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">given their short-term nature or with regards to long-term notes payable based on borrowing rates currently available to the Company for loans with similar terms and maturities.</font>&nbsp;&nbsp; </font></font></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Goodwill and Other Intangible Assets</font></b> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">- In June 2001, the Financial Accounting Standards Board issued SFAS No.</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">141, &ldquo;Business Combinations,&rdquo; and SFAS No. 142, &ldquo;Goodwill and Other Intangible Assets&rdquo;. SFAS No. 141 requires the use
            of the purchase method of accounting for all business combinations initiated after June 30, 2001. It also provides guidance on purchase accounting related to the recognition of intangible assets. SFAS No. 142 requires that goodwill and identifiable acquired intangible assets with indefinite useful lives shall no longer be amortized, but tested for impairment annually and whenever events or circumstances occur indicating that goodwill might be impaired. SFAS No. 142 also requires the
            amortization of identifiable assets with finite useful lives. Identifiable acquired intangible assets, which are subject to amortization, are to be tested for impairment in accordance with SFAS No. 144, &ldquo;Accounting for the Impairment or Disposal of Long-Lived Assets.&rdquo; <br>
            &nbsp; <br>
            The Company elected to adopt the provisions of SFAS No. 142 as of July 1, 2001</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">at which time only one business segment called the Data Storage segment was presented, which consisted of two separate entities. In May of 2002 the Company added its ATSI unit (the RFID Technology segment) and, effective June 30, 2006,</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">it added its StarTrak unit</font>
            <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">(the Wireless Asset Management segment). Upon adoption of SFAS No. 142, amortization of goodwill recorded for business combinations consummated prior to June 30, 2001 ceased, and intangible assets acquired prior to June 30, 2001 that did not meet the criteria for recognition apart from goodwill under SFAS No. 141 were reclassified to goodwill. In connection with the adoption of SFAS No. 142, the Company was required to perform a
            transitional goodwill impairment assessment. The annual goodwill impairment assessment involves estimating the fair value of the reporting unit and comparing it with the carrying amount. The Company determines the carrying value of each reporting unit by assigning assets and liabilities, including the existing goodwill and intangible assets, to the reporting units. If the carrying amount of the reporting unit exceeds its fair value, additional steps are followed to recognize a
            potential impairment loss. Calculating the fair value of the reporting units requires significant estimates and assumptions by management. The Company estimates the fair value of its reporting units by applying third-party market value indicators to the reporting unit&rsquo;s projected earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization. The Company completed its impairment tests with no adjustment to the carrying value of its goodwill as of June 30,
            2009.</font></font></font></p>
        </blockquote>

        <p></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">Intangible assets consist of goodwill, the excess of purchase price over fair value of net assets acquired in connection with the acquisitions of its wholly owned subsidiaries, and other intangible assets, including cost of licenses, patents, developed software, etc. Prior to fiscal year 2002, goodwill was being amortized over 15 years. Commencing in
            fiscal</font></font></p>
        </blockquote>

        <p align="center"></p>

        <div style="MARGIN-TOP: 12pt" title="PAGENUM" align="center">
            <a name="PAGENUM"><font color="#000000" size="2" face="Times New Roman">27</font></a>
        </div>

        <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 1px; FONT-SIZE: 1pt" title="EE+ Page Break">
            <hr width="100%" noshade>
        </div>

AND SUBSIDIARIES</b></font></font></b></font></p>

        <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (continued)</font></b></font></p>

        <p></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">year 2002, the Company adopted SFAS 142 and ceased amortizing goodwill balances over a specific period pursuant to SFAS 142. However, per Company policy, goodwill balances are reviewed at least annually to determine appropriateness of valuation and presentation based upon anticipated cash flows. See Impairment of Intangibles and Other Long-lived assets below for
            additional discussion of valuation for Intangible Assets.</font></font></p>
        </blockquote>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">On November 10, 2008, the Company announced the acquisition of certain assets of MicroLogic, Inc, (&ldquo;MicroLogic&rdquo;), a business that employs an integrated fleet management system that transmits</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">the location, run-hours and key operating metrics of mobile construction equipment to customers in
            real-time, using satellite communications, GPS positioning and Internet technologies.</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The purchase price</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">of $91,200, considering the issuance of 120,000 Class A Common Shares,</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">valued</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">at</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">$78,700</font>
            <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">related acquisition costs of $12,500,</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">is not considered material to the consolidated financial statements pursuant to the rules of the SEC. The purchase price in excess of net tangible assets acquired amounted to $91,200, which has been allocated $63,900 to Technology and Software Development and $27,300 to Customer Base and
            Backlog, based on estimated fair values of the assets.</font> </font></font></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The amortization expenses</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">for aggregate other intangible assets</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">for the fiscal years</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">ended June 30, 2009</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and 2008</font>
            <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">were</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">$438,000</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and $503,200, respectively.</font></font></font></p>
        </blockquote>

        <p></p>

        <p></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Income Taxes</font></b> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">- The Company accounts for income taxes under the asset and liability method, which requires recognition of deferred tax assets and liabilities for the expected future tax consequences of events that have been included in the financial statements or tax returns. Under this method, deferred
            tax assets and liabilities are determined based on the difference between the financial statement basis and tax basis of assets and liabilities using enacted tax rates in effect for the year in which the differences are expected to reverse.</font></font></font></p>

            <p></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Use of Estimates</font></b> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">- The preparation of the Company's financial statements in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America requires the Company's management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the amounts reported in these financial statements and
            accompanying notes. Actual results could differ from those estimates.</font></font></font></p>

            <p></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The Company makes significant assumptions concerning the estimated fair value of stock based compensation, the&nbsp;carrying value&nbsp;of its goodwill and other intangible assets, warranty reserves, percentage of completion method of accounting,</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">income and expense recognition,</font>
            <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">allowances for inventory and receivables, realization of deferred tax assets, and investments. Due to the uncertainties inherent in the estimation process and the significance of these items, it is at least reasonably possible that the estimates in connection with these items could be further materially revised within the next year. </font></font></font></p>

            <p></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Impairment of Other Long-Lived Assets</font></b> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">- The Company performs an assessment for impairment whenever events or changes in circumstances indicate that the carrying amount of a long-lived asset may not be recoverable. If the net carrying value of the asset exceeds estimated future net cash flows, then
            impairment is recognized to reduce the carrying value to the estimated fair value. No impairment charge was recorded during fiscal years</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">ended June 30, 2009</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">or 2008.</font> <br>
            &nbsp; </font></font></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Revenue Recognition</font></b> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">- The Company sells various products and services including a tracking and monitoring system for monitoring inmates and staff in prisons and county jails, monitoring/data transmission products and data services focused at the refrigerated or &ldquo;Reefer&rdquo; segment of the
            transport industry and data storage networking products. In addition, the Company provides extended warranty/maintenance contracts that in some cases include on site support. The Company sells products and services through its direct sales force as well as independent resellers. <br>
            &nbsp; <br>
            The Company recognizes revenue, net of anticipated returns, generally at the time products are shipped to customers, or at the time service is provided. Deferred revenue relates primarily to extended warranty/maintenance contracts and is recognized</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">ratably over the term of the maintenance or data services contract period.</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Revenues for products and services are generally recognized
            when</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">all of the following have been met:</font></font></font></p>
        </blockquote>

        <p></p>

            <tr>
                <td width="49">
                </td>

                </td>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">Data services and maintenance agreements are typically stated separately in an agreement. We have classified the value of revenues pertaining to the contractual maintenance obligations that exist for the 12-month period subsequent to the balance sheet date as a current liability, and the contractual obligations with a term beyond 12 months as a non-current
            liability.</font></font></p>
        </blockquote>

        <div style="MARGIN-TOP: 12pt" title="PAGENUM" align="center">
            <a name="PAGENUM"><font color="#000000" size="2" face="Times New Roman">29</font></a>
        </div>

        <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 1px; FONT-SIZE: 1pt" title="EE+ Page Break">
            <hr>
        </div>

        <div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12pt" title="EE+ Page Header">
            <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 12pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b>ALANCO TECHNOLOGIES, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</b></font></p>
        </div>

        <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (continued)</font></b></font></p>

        <p></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">Our arrangements with customers and resellers do not include any rights of return or price protection nor do arrangements with resellers include any acceptance provisions. The Company provides customers with a standard one year warranty included in the price of the product. Payment terms are typically due within 30 days of invoice date for product or
            service.</font></font></p>

            <p></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">Revenues from material long-term contracts that extend over a reporting period are recognized on the percentage-of-completion method for individual contracts, commencing when significant costs are incurred and adequate estimates are verified for substantial portions of the contract to where experience is sufficient to estimate final results with reasonable accuracy.
            Revenues are recognized by applying the ratio of costs incurred to date to the estimated total contract costs. Changes in job performance, estimated profitability and final contract settlements would result in revisions to costs and income, and are recognized in the period in which the revisions are determined. Contract costs include all direct materials, subcontracts, labor costs and those direct and indirect costs related to contract performance. General and administrative costs
            are charged to expense as incurred. At the time a loss on a contract becomes known, the entire amount of the estimated ultimate loss is accrued.</font></font></p>

            <p></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Loss Per Share</font></b> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">- The loss per share (&ldquo;EPS&rdquo;) is presented in accordance with the provisions of Statement of Financial Accounting Standards No. 128, &ldquo;Earnings Per Share&rdquo;</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">(SFAS</font>
            <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">128). Basic EPS is calculated by dividing the income or loss available to common shareholders by the weighted average number of common shares outstanding for the period. Diluted EPS reflects the potential dilution that could occur if securities or other contracts to issue common stock were exercised or converted into common stock. Basic and diluted EPS were the same for fiscal 2009</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and
            2008, as the Company had losses from operations during both years and therefore the effect of all potential common stock equivalents is antidilutive (reduces loss per share). Stock options representing 6,044,700</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">shares of Class A Common Stock were outstanding at year-end with exercise prices ranging between $.50</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and $4.37. The weighted average exercise price for all outstanding
            options was $0.94. Stock warrants representing 4,666,400</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Class A Common Shares were outstanding at year-end with exercise prices ranging between $.60</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and $5.00. The weighted average exercise price was $2.03.</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">In</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">addition, $1 million of the outstanding balance under the line of
            credit agreement is convertible into Class A Common Shares of the Company at a price of $1.25 per share and the $1 million ComVest note is</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">convertible, at June 30, 2009,</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">at $1.21 per share.</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">See Note 18 &ndash; Subsequent Event for discussion of an Amended and Restated Convertible Term Note related to the ComVest note that, among
            other things, changes the conversion price and repayment terms.</font>&nbsp; </font></font></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">At June 30, 2009, Preferred Stock outstanding included 100,700 shares of Series B Convertible Preferred Stock, 285,500 shares of Series D Preferred Stock (non-convertible) and 15,000 shares of Series E Convertible Preferred Stock</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">outstanding.</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The Series B
            Convertible Preferred shares are convertible into Class A Common shares at a ratio of 5.2</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">shares of common stock for each share of Series B Preferred. The Series E Convertible Preferred shares are each convertible into 12 shares of Class A Common shares. If both the Series B and Series E Convertible Preferred Stock had been converted into common shares at June 30, 2009</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">there would
            have been an additional 703,600 Class A Common shares outstanding.</font>&nbsp; </font></font></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><b>Stock Option Plans</b> - The Company has stock-based compensation plans and effective July 1, 2006, the Company adopted the fair value recognition provisions of Statement of Financial Accounting Standards No. 123 (revised 2004), &ldquo;Share-Based Payment&rdquo; (&ldquo;SFAS 123R&rdquo;), using the modified prospective transition method and therefore have not restated results for prior periods. Under
            this transition method, stock-based compensation expense for the fiscal years ended June 30, 2009 and 2008 include compensation expense for all stock-based compensation awards granted during the year, or granted prior to, but not fully vested as of July 1, 2006, based on the grant date fair value estimated in accordance with the original provision of Statement of Financial Accounting Standards No. 123, &ldquo;Accounting for Stock-based Compensation&rdquo; (&ldquo;SFAS 123&rdquo;).
            Stock-based compensation expense for all stock-based compensation awards granted after June 30, 2006 is based on the grant date fair value estimated in accordance with the provisions of SFAS 123R. The value of the compensation cost is amortized on a straight-line basis over the requisite service periods of the award (the option vesting term).</font></font></p>
        </blockquote>

        <p></p>

        <div style="MARGIN-TOP: 12pt" title="PAGENUM" align="center">
            <a name="PAGENUM"><font color="#000000" size="2" face="Times New Roman">30</font></a>
        </div>

        <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 1px; FONT-SIZE: 1pt" title="EE+ Page Break">
            <hr width="100%" noshade>
        </div>

        <p align="center"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">ALANCO TECHNOLOGIES, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</font></b></font></p>

        <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (continued)</font></b></font></p>

        <p></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">The Company estimates fair value using the Black-Scholes valuation model. Assumptions used to estimate compensation expense are determined as follows:</font></p>
        </blockquote>

        <p></p>

        <table>
            <tr>
                <td width="48">
                </td>

                <td valign="top">
                    <p><font size="2">&middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></p>
                </td>

                <td valign="top">
                    <p align="justify"><font size="2">Expected term for current year grants was determined under the simplified method using an average of the contractual term and vesting period of the award as appropriate statistical data required to properly estimate the expected term was not available. </font></p>
                </td>
            </tr>
        </table>
        <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><br>
        </font>

        <p></p>

        <table>
            <tr>
                <td width="48">
                </td>

                <td valign="top">
                    <p><font size="2">&middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></p>
                </td>

                <td valign="top">
                    <p align="justify"><font size="2">Expected volatility of award grants made under the Company&rsquo;s plans is measured using the historical daily changes in the market price of the Company&rsquo;s common stock over the expected term of the award; </font></p>
                </td>
            </tr>
        </table>
        <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><br>
        </font>

        <p></p>

        <table>

                    <p><font size="2">&middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></p>
                </td>

                <td valign="top">
                    <p align="justify"><font size="2">Risk-free interest rate is to approximate the implied yield on zero-coupon U.S. Treasury bonds with a remaining maturity equal to the expected term of the awards; and,</font></p>
                </td>
            </tr>
        </table>
        <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><br>

                </td>
            </tr>
        </table>
        <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><br>
        </font>

        <p></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Concentrations of Credit Risks and Significant </font></b><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Vendors and </font></b><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Customers</font></b> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">- The Company sells products and extends credit based on an evaluation of the customer's financial condition,
            generally without requiring collateral. Exposure to losses on receivables is principally dependent on each customer's financial condition. The Company monitors its exposure for credit losses and maintains allowances for anticipated losses.</font></font></font></p>

            <p></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">All</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">business segments of the Company utilize various domestic suppliers for purchases of materials and parts used to manufacture its products. During fiscal year ended June 30, 2009, due to the advantage of volume manufacturing, three suppliers</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">for the RFID
            Technology segment accounted for approximately</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">64% of purchases with the largest supplier accounting for approximately 28%. During the prior year, one supplier provided 78% of purchases in the year ended June 30, 2008. Two</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">domestic suppliers for the Wireless Asset Management segment accounted for approximately 21% and 27%</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">of
            those purchases</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">in fiscal year 2009, while the same suppliers accounted for 24% and 27% of total purchases in the prior fiscal year.</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">During fiscal 2009 four (4) suppliers for the Data Storage segment accounted for more than 10% of purchases</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">totaling 72% of total segment purchases. During 2008, two suppliers accounted for more
            than 66% of material and parts purchases. One supplier accounted for 34% and a second supplier accounted for 32% of purchases.</font></font></font></p>

            <p></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The Company anticipates</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">that due to the advantages of volume manufacturing, a</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">concentration of vendor purchases</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">may occur</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">in all business segments;
            however, additional suppliers are readily available at competitive pricing levels. </font></font></font></p>

            <p></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">One</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Data Storage customer accounted for 12% of the segment&rsquo;s fiscal year 2009</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">revenues, while</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">a different customer accounted for 10.5% of that segment&rsquo;s</font>
            <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">sales in fiscal year</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">2008.</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Neither customer had accounts receivable outstanding at the respective year end.</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">In the RFID Technology segment, three</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">customers</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">individually</font>
            <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">accounted for more than 10% of the segment&rsquo;s fiscal year 2009</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">revenues for a total of 78% of total segment revenues and 94% of total segment accounts receivable. During fiscal 2008, five customers</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">individually accounted for more than 10% of segment revenues</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">for a total of 76% of
            total segment revenues and 92% of total segment accounts receivable. In the Wireless Asset Management segment, three customers individually accounted for a total of 44.9% of fiscal year 2009 revenues and 52.3% of total segment accounts receivable. During fiscal 2008, the same three customers accounted for 55.8% of total segment revenues and 58.8% of total segment accounts receivable. Sales concentrations in all three business segments are the result of large contracts received or
            substantially fulfilled during the year. Sales concentrations may continue;</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">however,</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">large contract customers generally change</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">from year to</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">year.</font></font></font></p>
        </blockquote>

        <p></p>

        <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 1px; FONT-SIZE: 1pt" title="EE+ Page Break">

        <div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12pt" title="EE+ Page Header">
            <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 12pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b>ALANCO TECHNOLOGIES, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</b></font></p>
        </div>

        <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (continued)</font></b></font></p>

        <p></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The Company invests its excess cash in short term bank investments</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">that in some cases exceeds the</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">maximum FDIC insurance amount. At June 30, 2009, deposits in excess of FDIC insured limits amounted to $216,200. The Company in the future may elect to increase
            the number of accounts and the number of banks to keep the balances within the insurable amount. </font></font></font></p>

            <p></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Segment Information</font></b> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">- SFAS No. 131, &ldquo;Disclosure About Segments of an Enterprise and Related Information,&rdquo; defines operating segments as components of a company about which separate financial information is available that is evaluated regularly by the chief operating decision maker in
            deciding how to allocate resources and in assessing performance. The Company had</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">identified RFID Technology</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Wireless Asset Management as the two</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">continuing operating segments of the Company</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">for fiscal years</font>
            <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">2009</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and 2008. See Note 16</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">for further information related to the Company&rsquo;s operating segments.</font></font></font></p>

            <p></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><b>Recent Accounting Pronouncements &ndash;</b> In September 2006, the FASB issued SFAS 157 &ldquo;Fair Value Measurements&rdquo;, which established how companies should measure fair value when they are required to use a fair value measure for recognition of disclosure purposes under GAAP. This Statement is effective for financial statements issued for fiscal years beginning after November 15, 2007, and
            interim periods within those years. The provisions of SFAS 157 are effective for the Company in July 2008. The Company has evaluated the implact of this Statement on our consolidated financial statements,&nbsp;and has determined that&nbsp;SFAS 157 does not&nbsp;have a material effect.</font></font></p>

            <p></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">In April 2008, the FASB issued FSP 142-3, &ldquo;Determination of the Useful Life of Intangible Assets&rdquo; (&ldquo;FSP 142-3&rdquo;). FSP 142-3 amends the factors that should be considered in developing renewal or extension assumptions used to determine the useful life of a recognized intangible asset under SFAS No. 142, &ldquo;Goodwill and Other Intangible Assets.&rdquo; FSP 142-3 is effective for fiscal
            years beginning after December 15, 2008. The Company is currently assessing the impact of FSP 142-3 on its financial position and results of operations.</font></p>

            <p></p>

            <p dir="ltr" align="left"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">In May 2008, the FASB issued FASB Staff Position APB 14-1, <i>&ldquo;Accounting for Convertible Debt Instruments That May</i> <i>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</i> <i>Be Settled in Cash Upon Conversion (Including Partial Cash Settlement)</i> (&ldquo;APB 14-1&rdquo;)<i>.</i> APB 14-1 clarifies that &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;convertible debt instruments that may be settled in cash upon conversion
            (including partial cash settlement) are not &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;addressed by paragraph 12 of APB Opinion No. 14, <i>Accounting for Convertible Debt and Debt Issued with Stock</i> <i>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</i> <i>Purchase Warrants.</i> APB 14-1 is effective for fiscal years beginning after December 15, 2008. The Company is &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;currently assessing the impact of APB 14-1 on its financial position and results of operations.</font></p>

            <p></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">In June 2008, the FASB reached a consensus in Issue No. 07-5, <i>&ldquo;Determining Whether an Instrument (or Embedded Feature) Is Indexed to an Entity&rsquo;s Own Stock&rdquo;</i> (&ldquo;EITF 07-5&rdquo;). This Issue addresses the determination of whether an instrument (or an embedded feature) is indexed to an entity&rsquo;s own stock, which is the first part of the scope exception in paragraph 11(a) of SFAS
            133. EITF 07-5 is effective for fiscal years beginning after December 15, 2008, and interim periods within those fiscal years. Early application is not permitted. The Company is currently assessing the impact of EITF 07-5 on its financial position and results of operations.</font></p>

            <p></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">In October 2008, the FASB issued Staff Position No. EITF 08-9, <i>&ldquo;Milestones Method of Revenue Recognition&rdquo;</i> (&ldquo;EITF 08-9&rdquo;). EITF 08-9 addresses the accounting when entities enter into revenue arrangements with multiple payment streams for a single deliverable or a single unit of accounting. The FASB staff could not reach agreement on transition of EITF 08-9. The Company is currently
            assessing the impact of EITF 08-9 on its financial position and results of operations.<br>
            &nbsp; <br>
            In May 2009, the Financial Accounting Standards Board (&ldquo;FASB&rdquo;) issued Statement of Financial Accounting Standards No. 165 &ldquo;Subsequent Events&rdquo;. This statement was issued to establish general standards of accounting for and disclosure of events that occur after the balance sheet date but before financial statements are issued or are available to be issued. This statement sets forth the period after the balance sheet date during which management of a reporting
            entity should evaluate events or transactions that may occur for potential recognition or disclosure in the financial statements. This statement sets forth the circumstances under which an entity should recognize events or transactions occurring after the balance sheet date in its financial statements. This statement sets forth the disclosures that an entity should make about events or transactions that occurred after the balance sheet date. The provisions of SFAS No. 165 are
            effective for financial periods ending after June 15, 2009 and the Company has incorporated them into its consolidated financial statements.</font></p>
        </blockquote>

        <div style="MARGIN-TOP: 12pt" title="PAGENUM" align="center">
            <a name="PAGENUM"><font color="#000000" size="2" face="Times New Roman">32</font></a>
        </div>

        <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 1px; FONT-SIZE: 1pt" title="EE+ Page Break">
            <hr width="100%" noshade>
        </div>

        <p align="center"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">ALANCO TECHNOLOGIES, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</font></b></font></p>

        <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (continued)<br>
        </font></b></font></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">In June 2009, the Financial Accounting Standards Board (&ldquo;FASB&rdquo;) issued Statement of Financial Accounting Standards No. 168 &ldquo;The FASB Accounting Standards Codification and the Hierarchy of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles &ndash; a replacement of FASB Statement No. 162&rdquo;. This statement was issued to establish the FASB Accounting Standards Codification as the source of
            authoritative U.S. Generally Accepted Accounting Principles to be applied to nongovernmental entities. On the effective date of this statement, the Codification will supersede all then-existing non-SEC accounting and reporting standards. This statement is effective for financial statements issued for interim and annual period ending after September 15, 2009. The Company is currently assessing the impact of SFAS No. 168 on it financial reporting.</font></p>
        </blockquote>

        <p></p>

        <p></p>

        <p align="left"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">2</font></b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">STOCK-BASED COMPENSATION</font></b></font></font></p>

        <p></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">The Company has several employee stock option and officer and director stock option plans that have been approved by the shareholders of the Company. The plans require that options be granted at a price not less than market on date of grant. </font></p>

            <p></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">The Company uses the Black-Scholes option pricing model to estimate fair value of stock-based awards.</font></p>
        </blockquote>

        <p align="left"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Assumptions for awards of options granted during the years ended June 30, 2009 and 2008 were:<br>

            <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 12pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b>ALANCO TECHNOLOGIES, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</b></font></p>
        </div>

        &nbsp; </font></b></font></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr" align="left"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">During the fourth quarter of fiscal year 2009, the Board of Directors of the Company authorized the repricing of stock options to acquire up to 5,727,000 shares of the Company&rsquo;s Class A Common Stock. The selected stock options were held by directors, officers and employees of the Company, had a weighted average exercise price per share of $2.04 and an average remaining
            contractual term of slightly more than three years. The current value of the options selected for repricing, based upon the Black-Scholes valuation method, was approximately $187,900. <br>
            &nbsp; <br>
            The holders of the selected stock options were offered&nbsp;repriced options with a weighted average exercise price of $.80 and the identical remaining contractual term, however, the new stock options were to acquire shares representing a 20% reduction from initial shares under the repriced options. The value of the repriced stock options, again based upon the Black Scholes valuation method, was $354,800 or $166,900 greater that the repriced stock options resulting in an additional
            stock based compensation expense of $166,900 recorded as additional stock based compensation expense in the fourth quarter of fiscal year ended June 30, 2009. </font></p>

            <p style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr" align="left"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">As of June 30, 2009, total compensation costs related to non-vested awards not yet recognized amount to approximately $519,600 and are expected to be recognized as follows: fiscal year 2010 - $308,800; fiscal year 2011 - $167,400; fiscal year 2012 - $40,100 and fiscal year 2013 - $3,300.</font></p>
        </blockquote>

        <p></p>

        <p align="left"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">3</font></b><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;LIQUIDITY</font></b> <b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">AND GOING CONCERN</font></b> </font></font></p>

        <p></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The Company incurred significant losses and negative cash flows from operations during fiscal year ended June 30, 2009</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and in prior fiscal years, and anticipates additional losses and negative cash flows in early fiscal year 2010.</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">These factors, as well as
            the uncertain conditions that the Company faces regarding its ability to secure significant contracts for the TSI PRISM installations</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and StarTrak products, creates an uncertainty about the Company&rsquo;s ability to finance its operations and remain a going concern. Although management cannot assure that future operations will be profitable or that additional debt and/or equity capital will be raised, management believes</font>
            <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">cash balances at June 30, 2009</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">of approximately $413,500</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and the raising of approximately $541,000 of additional equity capital through the issuance of Series E Preferred Stock subsequent to year end, additional working capital anticipated to be generated through the sale of equity and working capital generated from the Company&rsquo;s
            operations,</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">will provide adequate capital resources to maintain the Company&rsquo;s net cash requirements for the next year. However, if additional working capital is required and not obtained through long-term debt, equity capital or operations, it could adversely affect future operations. Management has historically been successful in obtaining financing and has demonstrated the ability to implement a number of cost-cutting
            initiatives to reduce working capital needs. The Company requires and continues to pursue additional capital for growth and strategic plan implementation. Accordingly, the accompanying consolidated financial statements have been prepared assuming the Company will continue to operate and do not include any adjustments that might be necessary if the Company is unable to continue as a going concern. </font></font></font></p>

            <p align="center"></p>
        </blockquote>

        <div style="MARGIN-TOP: 12pt" title="PAGENUM" align="center">
            <a name="PAGENUM"><font color="#000000" size="2" face="Times New Roman">34</font></a>
        </div>

        <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 1px; FONT-SIZE: 1pt" title="EE+ Page Break">
            <hr width="100%" noshade>
        </div>

        <p align="center"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b>ALANCO TECHNOLOGIES, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</b></font></p>

        <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (continued)</font></b></font></b></font></font></p>

        <p align="left"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><b>4</b><b>.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; A</b><b>SSETS HELD FOR SALE</b>&nbsp; </font></font></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">During the quarter ended March 31, 2009, the Company implemented a plan to divest the operations of the&nbsp;Company&rsquo;s Data Storage segment and reinvest the proceeds into the Company&rsquo;s Wireless Asset Management and&nbsp;RFID Technology segments. At June 30, 2009 and June 30, 2008, the &ldquo;Assets Held for Sale&rdquo; and &ldquo;Liabilities Related&nbsp;to Assets Held for Sale&rdquo; consisted of
            the Data Storage segment assets and liabilities. The reclassification of the Data&nbsp;Services segment to &ldquo;Assets Held for Sale&rdquo; does not affect the reported net loss for the periods presented. The&nbsp;Company has entered into an agreement with an investment banker to represent the Company in the sale of the Data Storage segment assets, however a firm acceptable offer has not yet been received. The Company is continuing to operate the&nbsp;segment and believes the net
            asset value recorded for the business segment is appropriate.</font></p>
        </blockquote>

        <p></p>

        <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">5</font></b><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></b><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">NOTES RECEIVABLE</font></b></font></font></p>

        <p></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">During fiscal 2009, the Company concluded the TSIN Litigation by executing a settlement agreement that was based upon an independent valuation of the assets of TSIN on the date of acquisition by the Company. The appraisal was completed on October 7, 2008 and found that the consideration value paid by the Company for TSIN assets was within an acceptable value
            range, finally resolving the dispute. Pursuant to the terms of the Settlement Agreement,</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">substantially all claims between the parties</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">were cancelled resulting in the write-off of the $29,600 note receivable balance. See Note 8 &ndash; TSIN Litigation Settlement for additional discussion of the settlement</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">agreement.</font><br>
            </font></font></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The note receivable balance of $29,600 at June 30, 2008 related to advances made to TSIN in fiscal year 2005 to</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">assist the newly elected TSIN board of directors in obtaining legal representation.</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The Company</font>
            <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">had</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">received payments prior to June 30, 2008 on the note of approximately $50,000, reducing the note balance to $29,600 at June 30, 2008.</font></font></font></p>
        </blockquote>

        <p></p>

        <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">6</font></b><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; INVENTORIES</font></b></font></font></p>

        <p></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p align="left"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">Inventories consist of the following at June 30:</font></font></p>
        </blockquote>

        <p></p>

        <table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="500" align="center">
            <tr>
                <td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: medium none; BORDER-LEFT: medium none; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-LEFT: 0.07in; PADDING-RIGHT: 0.07in; BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; PADDING-TOP: 0in" valign="bottom" width="234"><font size="2">&nbsp;</font></td>

                    <p align="right">&nbsp;</p>

                <td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: medium none; BORDER-LEFT: medium none; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-LEFT: 0.07in; PADDING-RIGHT: 0.07in; BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; PADDING-TOP: 0in" valign="bottom" width="234">
                    <p align="left"><font size="2">Raw materials and purchased parts</font></p>

                <td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: medium none; BORDER-LEFT: medium none; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-LEFT: 0.07in; PADDING-RIGHT: 0.07in; BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; PADDING-TOP: 0in" valign="bottom" width="38">

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Inventory for the Data Storage segment is included in Assets Held for Sale</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">in the consolidated balance sheets at both June 30, 2009 and 2008. If the Data Storage segment&rsquo;s inventory balance is included in the consolidated inventory, inventory balances would increase by $527,200, net of a $59,300 reserve,
            and $803,300, net of a $56,000 reserve,</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">at June 30, 2009 and 2008, respectively. </font></font></font></p>

                <td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: medium none; BORDER-LEFT: medium none; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-LEFT: 0.07in; PADDING-RIGHT: 0.07in; BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; PADDING-TOP: 0in" valign="bottom" width="182">
                    <p align="left"><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp; Net book value</font></p>

        <p></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Property, Plant and Equipment for the Data Storage</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">segment is included in Assets Held for Sale</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">in the consolidated balance sheets</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">at both June 30, 2009 and 2008. If the Data Storage Property, Plant and
            Equipment balance is included in the consolidated Property, Plant and Equipment, the net balances would increased by $49,900 and $32,400 at June 30, 2009 and 2008, respectively. </font></font></font></p>
        </blockquote>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 12pt" title="EE+ Page Footer" align="center"></p>

        <div style="MARGIN-TOP: 12pt" title="PAGENUM" align="center">
            <a name="PAGENUM"><font color="#000000" size="2" face="Times New Roman">35</font></a>
        </div>

        <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 1px; FONT-SIZE: 1pt" title="EE+ Page Break">
            <hr>
        </div>

        <div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12pt" title="EE+ Page Header">
            <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 12pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b>ALANCO TECHNOLOGIES, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</b></font></p>
        </div>

        <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (continued)</font></b></font></p>

        <p></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Related depreciation expense for the years ended June 30, 2009</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and 2008, was $146,800</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and $123,200, respectively.</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Including Data Storage segment, consolidated depreciation expense would increase to $167,000
            and $151,000, respectively.</font></font></font></p>
        </blockquote>

        <p></p>

        <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">8</font></b><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">.</font></b>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">TSIN </font></b><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">LITIGATION SETTLEMENT</font></b></font></font></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p align="justify"><font size="2"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">On January 30, 2003, a shareholder of TSIN filed suite naming as defendants the Company and its wholly owned subsidiary, ATSI.&nbsp; The complaint set forth various&nbsp;allegations&nbsp;and sought damages arising out of the Company's acquisition of substantially all of the assets of TSIN.</font></font></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The parties to the lawsuit entered into a Settlement Agreement, which was attached as an exhibit to Form 8-K filed on September 21, 2007. In place of the litigation, the Settlement Agreement provided for a valuation procedure, conducted by an independent third party valuation expert, to value (i) the assets transferred by TSIN to Alanco and ATSI in connection
            with the Acquisition Agreement (&ldquo;Business Value&rdquo;), and (ii) the consideration paid by Alanco to</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">TSIN (&ldquo;Consideration Value&rdquo;). If the Consideration Value was determined to be within 15% of the Business Value, neither party was entitled to any damages or claims. All of the pending litigation matters were dismissed by the parties pending the appraisal. The appraisal was completed on October 7, 2008 and found
            that the Consideration Value was within 15% of the Business Value, finally resolving the dispute. </font></font></font></p>

            <p></p>

            <p align="left"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">As a result of the Settlement Agreement with the TSIN Bankruptcy Trustee and conclusions of the third party appraiser, all obligations of Alanco and ATSI to TSIN have been fully resolved, including any unpaid or contingent liabilities arising from the acquisition agreement through which Alanco acquired the assets of TSIN. Based upon the settlement, the Company
            recognized the write-off of approximately $314,100 in notes payable, including accrued interest,</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">presented in the notes to the condensed consolidated financial statements at June 30, 2008 as contingent notes payable</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and the $29,600 note receivable, among other claims,</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and recognized the adjustment as a reduction in legal
            expenses. </font></font></font></p>

            <p></p>

            <p align="left"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">The Settlement Agreement permits Alanco to continue to pursue its claims previously represented by filed Proofs of Claim against the TSIN estate which are unrelated to the settled lawsuit, which include claims for certain expenses incurred by Alanco on behalf of TSIN following the acquisition and claims for indemnity relating to obligations of TSIN not assumed by Alanco. The Company anticipates resolution of those
            claims in the near future.</font></p>
        </blockquote>

        <p></p>

        <p align="left"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">9</font></b><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">.</font></b><b>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">LINE OF CREDIT AND NOTES PAYABLE </font></b></font></font></p>

        <p></p>

            &nbsp; </font></font></p>
        </blockquote>

                    <p align="right"><font size="2">$ </font></p>

                <td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 3pt double; BORDER-LEFT: medium none; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-LEFT: 0.07in; PADDING-RIGHT: 0.07in; BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; PADDING-TOP: 0in" valign="bottom" width="81">
                    <p align="right"><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 3,508,400</font></p>
                </td>
            </tr>
        </table>

        <p></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">At June 30, 2009, the Company has</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">a $3,250,000 outstanding balance, presented as Notes payable &ndash; long-term,</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">under a $3.25</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">million Line of Credit Agreement</font>
            <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">(&ldquo;Agreement&rdquo;), presented</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">in the table&nbsp;above as &ldquo;Notes Payable &ndash; Trust&rdquo;.</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The Agreement is</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">with a private trust</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">controlled by Mr. Donald Anderson, owner of approximately 11.3% of the Company&rsquo;s
            Class A Common Stock and member of the Company&rsquo;s Board of Directors and was</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">initially entered into in June 2002, for an initial credit line of $1.3 million</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">secured by substantially all</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">of</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">the assets of the Company.</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The
            Agreement has been</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">amended various times since June 2002 with the last modification in January 2009.</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Under the amended agreement, which expires on July</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">1, 2010, the Company must maintain a minimum outstanding balance under the line of $2.50</font> million and pay interest at prime plus 3%</font></font></p>
        </blockquote>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 12pt" title="EE+ Page Footer" align="center">&nbsp;</p>
