        <div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12pt" title="EE+ Page Header">
            <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 12pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b>ALANCO TECHNOLOGIES, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</b></font></p>
        </div>

        <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (continued)<br>
        &nbsp; </font></b></font></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">(6.25% at June 30, 2009) on the outstanding balance up to $2 million and 12% on any balance in excess of $2 million.</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Under the Agreement, the lender has the unilateral right to reduce the line of credit under Agreement to $1.5</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">million, at which time the
            minimum outstanding balance under the Agreement reduces from $3.25</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">million to $1.5</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">million. In addition, $1,000,000 of the outstanding balance is convertible into Class A Common Shares of the Company</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">at a price of $1.25 per share.</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Interest payments made under the Agreement
            amount to $220,800</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and $170,500 in fiscal years ended June 30, 2009</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and 2008, respectively.</font> </font></font></p>

            <p></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The Contingent notes payable &ndash; TSI at June 30, 2008 represented</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">payables assumed as a</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">contingent</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">obligation under the TSI acquisition agreement. Under a Settlement Agreement executed in September 2007,
            all obligations of Alanco and ATSI to TSIN have been fully resolved, including the Contingent notes payable. See Note 8 for discussion on the TSIN Settlement.</font></font></font></p>

            <p></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Notes payable &ndash; StarTrak Acquisition at both June 30, 2009 and 2008</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">represent</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">primarily the balance of</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">unsecured notes</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">assumed in the StarTrak
            acquisition. During Fiscal 2009, various payments on the note were made reducing the balance from $460,000 to $360,000, with the remaining balance due on December 1, 2008. In December 2008, the Company agreed to amend the $360,000 Tenix note whereby the note would accrue interest at 12% per annum and was due June 1, 2009. See</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Note</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">18</font>
            <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">&ndash;</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Subsequent Events that</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">discusses a</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">restructuring</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">of</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">the Tenix note</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">subsequent to year-end.</font> </font></font></p>

            <p></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The $500,000 note payable - vendor was issued to TransCore Link Logistics Corp</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">(TransCore),</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">a StarTrak vendor who received the note in conversion of $500,000 of vendor payables. The unsecured note accrues interest, paid quarterly,</font>
            <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">at 15%, matures on December 31, 2011 and can be prepaid any time without penalty. During the quarter ended September 30, 2008, the Company was notified by Mr. Donald Anderson, a major shareholder and Director of the Company, that a trust controlled by the Anderson family had purchased the note from TransCore. The Anderson</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Trust currently holds the note</font>
            <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and received $56,300</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">in interest payments during fiscal 2009</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">from the Company. </font></font></font></p>

            <p></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">During August 2008, the Company amended its term loan agreement with ComVest Capital LLC, allowing the Company to prepay the</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">term loan without penalty and delaying related future monthly installment payments. The term loan, secured by certain assets of the Company,</font>
            <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">was prepaid down to $1 million during the quarter ended September 30, 2008, delaying future installment payments of $100,000 per month until September 2009 and resulting in a new loan maturity date of June 2010. Under the amended agreement, ComVest has the right to convert any outstanding principal amount and/or accrued interest thereon into Class A Common Stock at a price of $1.21 per share. In addition, the interest rate for the
            remaining $1 million balance at year end was 10.5%. Due to the prepayment, the Company expensed in the quarter ended September 30, 2008 previously deferred loan costs of approximately $216,000. During fiscal years</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">2009 and 2008 the Company paid $97,000</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and $338,700, respectively,</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">in interest to ComVest under the agreement. As of
            June 30, 2009, the note had minimum non-contingent required payments of $100,000 per month starting September 1, 2009, with the final payment on June 1, 2010. See Note 18</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">- Subsequent Event</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">for additional discussion of a</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">subsequent</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">restructuring of the ComVest term
            loan.</font></font></font></p>
        </blockquote>

        <p></p>

        <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">10</font></b><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </font></b><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">CONTRACTS</font></b> <b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">IN PROGRESS</font></b></font></font></p>

        <p></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The Company had</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">three</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">uncompleted contracts in progress at both June 30, 2009 and 2008</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">within the RFID Technology segment, for the installation of TSI PRISM systems.         <p></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">A valuation allowance is recognized if it is more likely than not that some or all of the deferred income tax assets will not be realized. A valuation allowance is used to offset the related income tax assets due to uncertainties of realizing the benefits of certain net operating loss and tax credits. The valuation allowance reflects a 100% reserve for all
            years reported above. At June 30, 2009,</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">the Company had net operating loss and capital loss carry-forwards for federal tax purposes of approximately $51,000,000. The loss carry-forwards, unless utilized, will expire from 2010</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">through 2029.</font></font></font></p>
        </blockquote>

        <p></p>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 12pt" title="EE+ Page Footer" align="center"></p>

        <div style="MARGIN-TOP: 12pt" title="PAGENUM" align="center">
            <a name="PAGENUM"><font color="#000000" size="2" face="Times New Roman">38</font></a>
        </div>

        <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 1px; FONT-SIZE: 1pt" title="EE+ Page Break">
            <hr>
        </div>

        <div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12pt" title="EE+ Page Header">
            <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 12pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b>ALANCO TECHNOLOGIES, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</b></font></p>
        </div>

        <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (continued)</font></b></font></p>

        <p align="left"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">1</font></b><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">2</font></b><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></b><b><font style="TEXT-TRANSFORM: uppercase; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Related Party Transactions</font></b></font></font></p>

        <p></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">At June 30, 2009 and 2008, the Company had a line of credit agreement (&ldquo;Agreement&rdquo;), more fully discussed in Note 9 &ndash; Line of Credit and Notes Payable, with a private trust (&ldquo;Lender&rdquo;) controlled by Mr. Donald Anderson, owner of approximately 11.3% of the Company&rsquo;s Class A Common Stock and member of the Company&rsquo;s Board of Directors. The Agreement was amended in August
            2008 increasing the credit limit by $500,000 to $2.5 million and again in January 2009, increasing the $2.5 million to $3.25 million. The interest rate on the August 2008 increase of $500,000 was fixed at twelve (12%) percent per annum and the Lender was given the right to convert up to $1 million of the outstanding balance into Class A Common Stock of the Company at a price of $1.25 per share. (The Lender previously had the right to convert up to $500,000 of the outstanding balance
            at a price of $1.50 per share). The interest rate for the January 2009 increase of $750,000 was also fixed at 12% in connection with the January 2009 amendment and the Company agreed to modify certain terms of existing warrants held by the Lender to purchase a total 270,000 shares of the Company&rsquo;s Class A Common Stock (prices from $1.25 to $2.37 per share). The modifications included extending the expiration date by 24 months and reducing the exercise price to $.60 per share.
            The warrant modifications had a Black-Scholes valuation of $62,400, which has been deferred as loan costs and will be amortized over the remaining period of the Agreement. Repayment of the $750,000 draw is specified as $375,000 due on or before September 30, 2009 and $375,000 due on or before March 31, 2010.</font></p>
        </blockquote>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">During the quarter ended September 30, 2008, the Company was notified by Mr. Donald Anderson that the Anderson Trust had purchased a StarTrak issued note payable in the amount of $500,000 from TransCore Link Logistics Corp., a vendor of StarTrak who had received the note earlier in the quarter. The note accrues interest at 15% per annum and interest is paid quarterly. The note matures on December 31, 2011 and
            can be prepaid at any time without penalty. </font></p>

            <p></p>

            <p align="justify"></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">The board of directors of the Company, during its October 2008 board meeting, approved a one-year expiration date extension for a group of warrants issued pursuant to private offerings to accredited investors for the purchase of Class A Common Stock. The warrants grant the right to purchase a total of 20,000 shares of the Company&rsquo;s Class A Common shares at a price of $1.50 per share and 460,000 shares at
            $1.25 per share. The warrants to purchase 20,000 shares at a price of $1.50 per share now expire on October 31, 2009, and the warrants to purchase 460,000 shares at a price of $1.25 per share now expire on November 16, 2009. Warrants for 300,000 of the 460,000 shares, or 65% of the total, were held by officers and directors of the Company. </font></p>

            <p></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">During January 2009, as an incentive for the holder to partially exercise warrants, the Company modified warrants issued to Programmed Land, Inc. to purchase 200,000 shares of the Company&rsquo;s Class A Common Stock by reducing the strike price to $.60 per share and extending the expiration date by two years. The modified warrants had a strike price of between $1.25 and $2.37 per share and expired in November
            2009 and June 2010. Programmed Land, Inc. is controlled by Donald Anderson, a member of the Company&rsquo;s Board of Directors and owner of approximately 11.3% of the Company&rsquo;s stock. During January 2009, the holder exercised 16,667 warrants with proceeds of $10,000.</font></p>

            <p></p>

            <p align="left"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">The Company&rsquo;s subsidiary, StarTrak Systems, LLC, obtains certain software engineering services from ST Wireless, a company organized and operating under the laws of India. Timothy P. Slifkin, a director of Alanco and StarTrak&rsquo;s president, had assisted with&nbsp;the formation&nbsp;of ST Wireless in India, prior to Alanco's acquisition of StarTrak in June 2006.&nbsp;&nbsp; ST Wireless has continued to
            perform those software engineering services since the acquisition.&nbsp; For the years ended June 30, 2009 and 2008, StarTrak paid ST Wireless $24,400 and $180,900, respectively, for services performed. Mr. Slifkin represents that he has no ownership interest in ST Wireless, nor does he have any option to acquire any interest in ST Wireless, however he does have a relationship with ST Wireless as described in the following paragraph. </font></p>

            <p></p>

            <p align="left"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">Mr. Slifkin has recently informed Alanco that he owns 60% of the outstanding membership interests of August Matrix, LLC, a New Jersey limited liability company formed in 2008 to represent ST Wireless in the United States. Since August, 2008, StarTrak has remitted all payments to August Matrix for services provided by ST Wireless to StarTrak. For the year ended June 30, 2009 StarTrak paid August Matrix $205,400
            (Mr. Slifkin&rsquo;s apportioned share&nbsp;being $123,200) and is currently paying August Matrix approximately $18,000 (Mr. Slifkin&rsquo;s portion being $10,800) per month. Mr. Slifkin further informed the Company that all of the monies paid by StarTrak to August Matrix were, in turn, paid by August Matrix to ST Wireless for the benefit of StarTrak, and that Mr. Slifkin has received no disbursements or compensation from either August Matrix or ST Wireless. Amounts due either ST
            Wireless or August Matrix at June 30, 2009 or 2008 were not deemed material.</font></p>
        </blockquote>

        <p></p>

        <div style="MARGIN-TOP: 12pt" title="EE+ Page Footer">
            <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 12pt" align="center">&nbsp;</p>
        </div>

        <p></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">During fiscal year 2008, as more fully described in Note 14</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">- Shareholders&rsquo; Equity, the Company raised approximately $7.9</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">million</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">in private offerings to accredited investors, with $1.3 million</font>
            <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">being attributable to insiders</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">of the Company. </font></font></font></p>

        <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">1</font></b><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">3</font></b><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; COMMITMENTS AND CONTINGENCIES</font></b></font></font></p>

                </td>

                <td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: medium none; BORDER-LEFT: medium none; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-LEFT: 0.07in; PADDING-RIGHT: 0.07in; BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; PADDING-TOP: 0in" valign="bottom" width="79"><font size="2">&nbsp;</font></td>

                <td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: medium none; BORDER-LEFT: medium none; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-LEFT: 0.07in; PADDING-RIGHT: 0.07in; BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; PADDING-TOP: 0in" valign="bottom" width="8"><font size="2">&nbsp;</font></td>

                <td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: medium none; BORDER-LEFT: medium none; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-LEFT: 0.07in; PADDING-RIGHT: 0.07in; BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; PADDING-TOP: 0in" valign="bottom" width="58">
                    <p align="right"><font size="2">192,400</font></p>
                </td>
            </tr>

            <tr>
                <td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: medium none; BORDER-LEFT: medium none; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-LEFT: 0.07in; PADDING-RIGHT: 0.07in; BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; PADDING-TOP: 0in" valign="bottom" width="29"><font size="2">&nbsp;</font></td>

                <td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: medium none; BORDER-LEFT: medium none; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-LEFT: 0.07in; PADDING-RIGHT: 0.07in; BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; PADDING-TOP: 0in" valign="bottom" width="91"><font size="2">&nbsp;</font></td>

                <td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: medium none; BORDER-LEFT: medium none; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-LEFT: 0.07in; PADDING-RIGHT: 0.07in; BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; PADDING-TOP: 0in" valign="bottom" width="79"><font size="2">&nbsp;</font></td>

                <td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: medium none; BORDER-LEFT: medium none; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-LEFT: 0.07in; PADDING-RIGHT: 0.07in; BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; PADDING-TOP: 0in" valign="bottom" width="8">
                    <p align="right"><font size="2">$</font></p>
                </td>

                <td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 3pt double; BORDER-LEFT: medium none; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-LEFT: 0.07in; PADDING-RIGHT: 0.07in; BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; PADDING-TOP: 0in" valign="bottom" width="58">
                    <p align="right"><font size="2">1,413,300</font></p>
                </td>
            </tr>
        </table>

        <p></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Future minimum payments for fiscal years 2015</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">through 2018 amount to $873,800. Rent expense related to these operating leases totaled approximately $425,000 and $324,700</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">for the years ended June 30, 2009</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and
            2008, respectively. </font><br>
            &nbsp; </font></font></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Legal Proceedings </font></b><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">&ndash; </font></b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The Company is a plaintiff in litigation initiated by its subsidiary, StarTrak Systems, LLC, against former employees and others for violation of certain non-disclosure covenants and for misappropriation of trade
            secrets. The Company continues as a party to certain post-litigation procedures relating to the acquisition, in May of 2002, of substantially all the assets of Technology Systems International, Inc., a Nevada Corporation (&ldquo;TSIN&rdquo;), and to litigation arising from an expired property lease between the Company's former subsidiary, Arraid, Inc., and Arraid Property L.L.C., an Arizona limited liability company. The legal proceedings are more fully described
            below.</font></font></font></p>
        </blockquote>

        <p></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><u>StarTrak Systems Litigation</u>&nbsp;<br>
            &nbsp;&nbsp;<br>
            On July 12, 2007, the Company&rsquo;s subsidiary, StarTrak Systems, LLC, commenced a lawsuit against Brian Hester, Satamatics, Ltd., Satamatics, Inc., and Farruhk Shahzad in the United States District Court, District of New Jersey, as case number 07-3203(DRD), for misappropriation of trade secrets, violation of confidentiality agreements and contempt for violation of a previously issued court order concerning such trade secrets issued to Brian Hester. Brian Hester and Farruhk
            Shahzad are previous employees of StarTrak, and the Company believes that they have employed and/or are attempting to employ trade secrets of StarTrak in connection with their association with Satamatics in direct competition with StarTrak. The Company is seeking injunctive relief and damages from the defendants. Settlement discussions are proceeding and the Company anticipates conclusion of the litigation in the near future.</font></font></font></p>
        </blockquote>

        <blockquote dir="ltr">
            <p></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><u>Arraid Litigation</u>&nbsp;&nbsp; </font></font></font></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">On July 18, 2003, Arraid Property L.L.C., an Arizona Limited Liability Company ("Arraid LLC"), filed a complaint in the Arizona Superior Court in and for Maricopa County, Arizona (case number CV 2003-13999) against the Company and its wholly owned subsidiary, Arraid, Inc., alleging breach of lease and seeking substantial monetary damages in excess of $3 million. The
            suit relates to an expired lease agreement for property previously leased by Arraid. Following a trial, the Court found in favor of Arraid LLC against the Company with respect to certain factual findings resulting in damages owed by the Company in an amount of approximately $35,000, less than one percent of the amount sought by the plaintiff. The court determined that the plaintiff was the prevailing party, and awarded the plaintiff approximately $95,000 in attorney&rsquo;s fees and
            costs. The Company appealed the decision to the Arizona Court of Appeals. The Court of Appeals vacated the award of attorney&rsquo;s fees against the Company as well as some of the damages awarded to the plaintiff, awarded the Company $60,000 in appeal legal fees and in excess of $10,000 in appeal costs, and returned the case to the trial court to determine the final judgment and to award the successful party its legal fees. The matter has been fully briefed in the Superior Court
            and the company anticipates final resolution of the matter in the near future.</font></font></p>

            <p></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">The Company may also, from time to time, be involved in litigation arising from the normal course of business. As of June 30, 2009 there was no such litigation pending deemed material by the Company.</font></font></p>
        </blockquote>

        <p align="justify"></p>

        <p align="justify"></p>

        <p></p>

            <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 12pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b>ALANCO TECHNOLOGIES, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</b></font></p>

        <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (continued)</font></b></font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </font></p>

        <table>
            <tr>
                <td width="24">
                </td>

                <td valign="top">
                    <p><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">14.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></b></p>
                </td>

                <td valign="top">
                    <p align="justify"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">SHAREHOLDERS&rsquo; EQUITY</font></b></p>
                </td>
            </tr>
        </table>
        <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><br>
        </font>

        <p></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Preferred Shares </font></b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">&ndash; In fiscal 2003, the Company allocated 5,000,000 of the 25,000,000 authorized shares of the Company&rsquo;s Preferred Stock to be known as Series A Convertible Preferred Stock (&ldquo;Series A&rdquo;). Holders of Series A Preferred Stock are entitled to receive, when declared by
            the Board of Directors, out of funds and assets of the Company legally available therefore, an annual dividend of 12% per annum, paid in kind semi-annually, based upon a per share value of $1.50 for purposes of such dividend payment. Dividends shall accrue and be cumulative from the date of issue. The Company had</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">completed a number of private transactions with accredited investors resulting in the issuance of Series A Preferred
            Stock. In that regard, the Company completed, during the quarter ended March 31, 2008, an offering to accredited investors of 1,425,500 Units at a unit price of $1.50, each unit consisting of one share of its Series A Convertible Preferred Stock (&ldquo;Series A&rdquo;) together with a 5-year warrant to purchase one share of the Company&rsquo;s Class A Common Stock at a price of $1.75 per share. The warrants included a redemption feature that effectively forces the warrant to be
            exercised in the event the market price of the Company&rsquo;s Common Stock reached $3.50 per share. The Series A Convertible Preferred Stock is convertible into 1.2 shares of the Company&rsquo;s Class A Common Stock. The Company may redeem the Series A Preferred Shares for $1.50 per share, provided the Common Stock achieves a trading value in excess of $5.00 for twenty consecutive trading days and meets minimum daily trading volume requirements. The Company received $2,107,500, net
            of expense, from the offering with $1,736,500 attributable to the Series A Preferred Stock and $371,000 attributable to the warrants to purchase common shares</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and as such recorded in Common Stock.</font> <br>
            &nbsp; <br>
            <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The Series A Preferred Stock offering was</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">recorded giving consideration to the value of the underlying common shares into which the Preferred A is convertible and to a Black Scholes value for the related warrants. The Company allocated the proceeds of the offering based upon related fair values. The Black Scholes method does not consider the effect of the warrant&rsquo;s force conversion
            feature and no adjustment was made. Based upon the implied value of warrants, utilizing a volatility of 62%</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">based on weekly weighted average changes in the market price and an assumed time to expiration of 912 days, a beneficial conversion feature of $264,000 was determined and is recorded as a special Series A Preferred Stock Dividend. The implied value for the warrants has been credited to Common Stock in fiscal year 2008. The
            recording of the Series A Preferred Stock beneficial conversion feature under this methodology increases the Net Loss Attributable to Common Shareholders by the amount of the special dividend but has no effect on cash or equity.</font>&nbsp; </font></font></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The Company&rsquo;s board of directors elected, during the fourth quarter of fiscal 2008,</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">to provide an incentive to the holders of Series A Preferred Stock to convert their</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Preferred Shares into Class A Common Shares at the ratio of 1.2 shares of Common
            Stock for each share of Series A Preferred Stock. As part of that incentive, the board declared a</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">regular Series A Preferred &ldquo;in-kind&rdquo; semi-annual dividend (normally scheduled to be declared in July 2008)</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">one month early and declared an additional special 10% &ldquo;in-kind&rdquo; dividend to holders of Series A Preferred Stock who converted their holdings into Class A
            Common Stock of the Company</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">by the end of fiscal year 2008. As a result of that incentive, all Series A Preferred Shares were converted into common shares by June 30, 2008. The additional special 10% dividend&nbsp;<font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">issued to Series A Preferred Stock holders as incentive to convert to common stock amounted to 597,600 shares valued at $896,400.</font></font></font></font></p>

            <div style="MARGIN-TOP: 12pt" title="EE+ Page Footer">
                <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 12pt" align="center">&nbsp;</p>
            </div>
        </blockquote>
        <!-- PAGE BREAK  -->

        <div style="MARGIN-TOP: 12pt" title="PAGENUM" align="center">
            <a name="PAGENUM"><font color="#000000" size="2" face="Times New Roman">41</font></a>
        </div>

        <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 1px; FONT-SIZE: 1pt" title="EE+ Page Break">
            <hr>
        </div>

        <div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12pt" title="EE+ Page Header">
            <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 12pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b>ALANCO TECHNOLOGIES, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</b></font></p>
        </div>

        <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (continued)&nbsp; </font></b></font></p>

        <p></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The Company issued 791,400 shares</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">(excluding the special conversion dividend) representing &ldquo;in kind&rdquo; dividends to the holders of</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Series A shares in fiscal 2008, with a</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">values of approximately
            $1,187,000. 329,400 shares representing fiscal 2008 &ldquo;in kind&rdquo; dividends were related to the dividend normally declared in the following fiscal year. During fiscal 2008, 6,574,300 Series A Convertible Preferred Stock were converted into Class A Common Shares and at June 30, 2009 and 2008, no Series A Preferred Stock</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">remained outstanding.</font></font></font></p>

            <p></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">During the quarter ended June 30, 2008, the Company allocated 500,000 of the authorized shares of the Company&rsquo;s Preferred Stock to be known as Series D Preferred Stock (&ldquo;Series D&rdquo;).</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The Series D Preferred Stock has a priority ranking superior to the Common Stock of the Company and all other
            series of preferred stock, except the Series A Convertible Preferred Stock and the Series B Convertible Preferred Stock, which has a ranking superior to the Series D Preferred Stock, with respect to payment of dividends and upon dissolution, liquidation and</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">winding-up of the Company. Holders of Series D are entitled to receive, when declared by the Board of Directors, out of funds and assets of the Company legally available
            therefore, an annual cash dividend of 15% per annum, paid quarterly, based upon a per share value of $10.00 for purposes of such dividend payment. The rate increases to 20% in the event the Series D is not redeemed by December 31, 2009. Dividends shall accrue and be cumulative from the date of issue. </font></font></font></p>

            <p></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">The Company&nbsp;completed a private offering to accredited investors during the quarter ended September 30, 2008, with the issuance of 180,000 shares of Class D Preferred Stock at a price of $10 per share. 130,000, or 72%, of the 180,000 Series D Preferred Shares were sold to directors and officers of the Company,
            including 100,000 issued to companies controlled by Mr. Anderson. The Company received $1,795,200, net of expenses of $4,800, for the offering. </font></font></font></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">During the quarter ended June 30, 2009, the Company allocated 750,000 of the authorized shares of the Company's Preferred Stock to be known as Series E Convertible Preferred Stock ("Series E").&nbsp; The Series E shares are each convertible into 12 shares of Common Stock and each Series E Share has voting rights equal to the number of shares of Common Stock into
            which the Series&nbsp;E is convertible.&nbsp; The Series E Preferred Stock has a priority ranking superior to the Common Stock of the Company and all other series of preferred stock of the Company, except the Series A Convertible Preferred Stock, Series B Convertible Preferred Stock and Series D Preferred Stock of the Company, which all shall have a ranking superior to the Series E Convertible Preferred Stock, with respect to payment of dividends, and upon dissolution, liquidation
            and winding-up of the Company.&nbsp; Holders of Series E are entitled to receive, when declared by the Board of Directors, out of funds and assets of the Company legally available therefore, an annual cash dividend of 5% per annum, paid quarterly, to shareholders of record on the respective record date.&nbsp; Dividends on each share of the Series E Convertible Preferred Stock shall accrue and be cumulative from the date of issue.</font></font></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">The Company issued 15,000 Series E shares during the quarter ended June 30, 2009 to a vendor for services valued at $67,500.&nbsp; See Note 18 - Subsequent Events that discusses additional Series E Convertible Preferred Stock issued subsequent to year-end.</font></font></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">During the fourth quarter</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">of fiscal 2008, the Company</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">completed</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">a</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">private offering to accredited investors of the Series D shares at a price of $10.00 per
            share. The Company issued 100,000 shares under the offering and received $1,000,000 ($997,100 net of expenses). During the first quarter of fiscal 2009, the Company completed another</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">round of Series D Preferred Shares in a private offering to accredited investors</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">receiving $1,795,200, net</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">of expenses of $4,700.</font>
            <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The Series D shares have a stated accumulated dividend rate of 15% of the $10.00 par value</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and are</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">not convertible into common shares.</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Each share of Series D Preferred Stock has voting rights equal to 7</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">shares of the Company&rsquo;s
            Common Stock. 50% (50,000 shares) of the Series D shares issued were purchased by a trust controlled by an insider of the Company. </font></font></font></p>

            <p></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">During fiscal 2002, the Company allocated 500,000 of the authorized shares of the Company&rsquo;s Preferred Stock to be known as Series B Convertible Preferred Stock (&ldquo;Series B&rdquo;), and in a transaction with an accredited investor, the Company issued 50,000 shares of Series B at $10.00 per share and 200,000 warrants to purchase Common Stock at an
            exercise price of $2.50 per share for a value received of $500,000 ($487,300 net of related expenses). The Series B Convertible Preferred Stock has priority ranking superior to the Common Stock of the Company and all other series of preferred stock with respect to payment of dividends and upon dissolution, liquidation and winding-up of the Company. The preferred shares are</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">each convertible into 5.2</font>
            <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">shares of Common Stock</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and each Series B Preferred Share has voting rights equal to the number of shares of Common Stock into which the Series B is convertible. Holders of shares of the Company&rsquo;s Series B Preferred Stock shall be entitled to receive, when declared by the Board of Directors, out of funds and assets of the Company legally available therefore, an annual dividend of
            10% per annum based upon a per share value of $10 for purposes of such dividend payment. Dividends shall accrue, be cumulative from the date of issue and may be paid "in kind." Dividends on Series B Preferred Shares paid "in-kind" during</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">fiscal</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">2009</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and fiscal 2008</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">amounted to
            9,400 and 8,600 Series B Preferred Shares with values of approximately $94,100 and $85,500, respectively. At June 30, 2009</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and 2008, there were 100,700 and 91,3</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">00 shares of Series B Convertible Preferred Stock outstanding, respectively.</font></font></font></p>
        </blockquote>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 12pt" title="EE+ Page Footer" align="center"></p>

        <div style="MARGIN-TOP: 12pt" title="PAGENUM" align="center">

        <div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12pt" title="EE+ Page Header">
            <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 12pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b>ALANCO TECHNOLOGIES, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</b></font></p>
        </div>

        <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (continued)</font></b></font></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The Series A,</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Series B, Series D, and Series E</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Preferred Shares</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">are characterized as "restricted securities" under federal securities laws as they were acquired from the Company in a transaction not
            involving a public offering and that under such laws and applicable regulations such shares may be resold without registration under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, only in certain limited circumstances.</font> </font></font></p>

            <p align="justify"><font size="2">The following is a summary of Preferred Stock Dividends paid during the fiscal years ended June 30:</font></p>
        </blockquote>

        <p></p>

        <table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="575" align="center">
            <tr>
                <td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: medium none; BORDER-LEFT: medium none; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-LEFT: 0.07in; PADDING-RIGHT: 0.07in; BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; PADDING-TOP: 0in" valign="bottom" width="309"><font size="2">&nbsp;</font></td>

                <td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: medium none; BORDER-LEFT: medium none; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-LEFT: 0.07in; PADDING-RIGHT: 0.07in; BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; PADDING-TOP: 0in" valign="bottom" width="20"><font size="2">&nbsp;</font></td>

                <td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 0.5pt solid; BORDER-LEFT: medium none; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-LEFT: 0.07in; PADDING-RIGHT: 0.07in; BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; PADDING-TOP: 0in" valign="bottom" width="63">
                    <p align="center"><b><font size="2">2009</font></b></p>
                </td>

                <td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: medium none; BORDER-LEFT: medium none; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-LEFT: 0.07in; PADDING-RIGHT: 0.07in; BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; PADDING-TOP: 0in" valign="bottom" width="20"><font size="2">&nbsp;</font></td>

        <p></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Common Shares</font></b> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">- The authorized capital stock of the Company consists of 75,000,000 shares of Class A Common Stock (reduced from the previously authorized 100,000,000 shares), each entitled to one vote per share, and 25,000,000 shares of Class B Common Stock, each entitled to one-one hundredth (1/100th)
            of one vote per share. No Class B Common Stock has been issued and none was outstanding at June 30, 2009</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and 2008. </font></font></font></p>

            <p></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">During the fiscal year ended June 30, 2009, the Company issued 836,300 of Class A Common Stock. 251,100 shares, valued at $257,200, were issued for options and warrants exercised, 204,000 shares were issued in exchange for services valued at $85,300, 120,000 shares, valued at $78,700, were issued for an acquisition and 260,800 shares valued at $97,200 were issued in partial payment of Series D Preferred Stock
            dividends. The Company also recognized as an expense during the year, $1,480,600 related to the value of stock based compensation (Stock Options). In addition, the Company agreed, as partial consideration for an amendment to a line of credit, to modify terms of existing outstanding warrants held by the Lender to purchase a total of 270,000 shares of the Company&rsquo;s Class A Common Stock (prices from $1.25 to $2.37 per share). The modifications included extending the expiration
            date by 24 months and reducing the exercise price to $.60 per share. The warrant modification had a Black-Scholes valuation of $62,400, which has been recorded as equity. Nasdaq listing fees for fiscal 2009 amounted to $49,300.</font></p>

            <p></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The Company issued during fiscal year 2008 a total of 11,204,600 shares of Class A Common Stock. 7,889,200 shares, valued at $8,750,000, were issued for the conversion of 6,574,300 Series A Preferred Shares to Common</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Shares.</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">2,453,900 shares were issued in
            connection with August 2007 private offerings of units consisting of one share of Class A Common Stock together with a 3-year warrant to purchase .4 shares of the Company&rsquo;s Class A Common Stock at a price of $3.00 per share. The units were priced at $2.00 per unit, resulting in proceeds, net of costs of $172,300, of $4,752,700.</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">In addition,</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">800,000 shares were issued to
            convert $1,000,000 of the Tenix notes payable to equity. Of the remaining shares, 10,000 were issued</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">in connection with the exercise of employee stock options resulting in proceeds of $9,200, 41,500 shares, valued at $69,200, were issued to outside vendors as payment for services rendered,</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">10,000 shares were issued</font>
            <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">for loan fees valued at $20,800. Additional increases to common stock resulted from an imputed common stock dividend of $264,000 and warrants</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">to purchase 1,425,500 shares at $1.75 per share, valued at $371,000,</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">related to a private offering of units that consisted of Series A Preferred Stock and warrants and $423,000 related to the
            value of stock based compensation expensed during the year. Nasdaq listing fees, associated with listing the additional shares in fiscal year 2008, amounted to $42,000. </font></font></font></p>

            <p></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">During the fourth quarter of fiscal year 2009, the Board of Directors of the Company authorized the repricing of stock options to acquire up to 5,727,000 shares of the Company&rsquo;s Class A Common Stock. The selected stock options were held by directors, officers and employees of the Company, had a weighted average exercise price per share of $2.04 and an average
            remaining contractual term of slightly more than three years. The current value of the options selected for repricing, based upon the Black-Scholes valuation method, was approximately $187,900. <br>
            &nbsp; <br>
            The holders of the selected stock options were offered&nbsp;repriced options with a weighted average exercise price of $.80 and the identical remaining contractual term, however, the new stock options were to acquire shares representing a 20% reduction from initial shares under the repriced options. The value of the repriced stock options, again based upon the Black Scholes valuation method, was $354,800 or $166,900 greater that the repriced stock options resulting in an additional
            stock based compensation expense of $166,900 recorded as additional stock based compensation expense in the fourth quarter of fiscal year ended June 30, 2009. </font></font></p>
        </blockquote>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 12pt" title="EE+ Page Footer" align="center"></p>

            <a name="PAGENUM"><font color="#000000" size="2" face="Times New Roman">43</font></a>

        <div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12pt" title="EE+ Page Header">
            <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 12pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b>ALANCO TECHNOLOGIES, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</b></font></p>
        </div>

        <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (continued)</font></b></font></p>

        <p></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The Company also elected to immediately vest certain stock options held by officers and directors where continued employment was not required under the vesting schedule. The immediate vesting resulted in additional stock based compensation expense for the fiscal year ended June 30, 2009 of approximately $700,000.</font> </font></font></p>

            <p></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The value of employee stock-based compensation recognized for the year ended June 30, 2009</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and 2008</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">amounted to</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">$1,480,600 and $423,000, respectively. The Company initiated the expensing of stock-based
            compensation on July 1, 2006. See Note 1 &ndash; Nature of Operations and Significant Accounting Policies and Note 2 &ndash; Stock-Based Compensation for additional discussion of the Company&rsquo;s policies related to employee stock-based compensation. </font></font></font></p>

            <p></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Warrants</font></b> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">- As of June 30, 2009, the Company had 4,666,400</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">warrants outstanding with a weighted average exercise price of $2.03.</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The life of the outstanding warrants extends from October 2009</font>
            </font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">through April 2016. The following is a table of activity related to all warrants.<br>
            &nbsp; </font></font></p>
        </blockquote>

        <table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="545" align="center">
            <tr>
                <td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: medium none; BORDER-LEFT: medium none; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-LEFT: 0.07in; PADDING-RIGHT: 0.07in; BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; PADDING-TOP: 0in" valign="bottom" width="30"><font size="2">&nbsp;</font></td>

        <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (continued)</font></b></font></p>

                    <p align="left"><font size="2">(7) Issued in connection with September 2006 term loan financing</font></p>
                </td>

        <p></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">There were 16,667</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">warrants exercised in fiscal 2009 generating</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">$10,000. During fiscal 2008, no warrants</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">were exercised.</font></font></font></p>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Stock Options</font></b> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">- As of June 30, 2009, the Company had a total of 6,044,700 stock options outstanding with a weighted average exercise price of $0.94. Of these options, 4,157,900</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">are exercisable at 2009</font>
            </font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">fiscal year end. The tables below, as well as the narrative following, provide further information regarding the Company&rsquo;s stock options.<br>
            &nbsp; </font></font></p>
        </blockquote>

        <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 12pt" title="EE+ Page Footer" align="center">&nbsp;</p>

            <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">options for</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">4,157,900</font> </font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">shares were exercisable and options for the remaining shares become exercisable within the next four years.                     <p><font size="2">$0.94</font></p>

        <p></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The Company&rsquo;s</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Stock Option Plans are administered by the Compensation/Administration Committee, currently comprised of two independent members of the Company&rsquo;s Board of Directors. Company stock options are issued to employees at an exercise price not less than the fair market value, as determined
            under the option plan, on the date of grant and must be granted within 10 years from the effective date of the Plan, with the term of the option not exceeding 10 years.</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Options granted to employees under the Stock Option Plans, which are terminated prior to exercise, are considered to be available for grant to subsequent employees. Total issued stock options for any plan may exceed those authorized due to termination of prior
            non-exercised grants. Under the Employee Incentive Stock Option Plans, incentive and non-qualified stock options may be granted, with the incentive stock options intended to qualify under Section 422 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended. Unless otherwise established by the Committee, the standard vesting schedule for the incentive stock options</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">issued currently</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">is 10%
            vested immediately upon grant, 15% vested after twelve months</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">from date of grant,</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">25% after two years</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">from the date of grant, 25% after three</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">years, and 25% after four</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">years. All of the options have been or will be registered
            on Form S-8 filings. See Notes 1 and 2 for a discussion of the applicable accounting treatment of stock-based compensation for fiscal years 2009</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and 2008.</font></font></font></p>
        </blockquote>

        <p></p>

        <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">1</font></b><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">5</font></b><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; RETIREMENT PLAN</font></b></font></font></p>

        <p></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The Company provides a 401(k) retirement plan for its employees. Employees are eligible to participate in the plan on the first of the month following 90 days of continuous employment. Employee salary deferral rates are not restricted by the Company, however, IRS limits and limitations imposed by discrimination tests may affect the allowed salary deferral rate.
            The Company matches 25% of the amount deferred by employees, matching up to 4% of an employee&rsquo;s annual compensation. The Company&rsquo;s matching contributions totaled $20,800</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and $29,100 for the years ended June 30, 2009</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and 2008, respectively.</font></font></font></p>
        </blockquote>

        <p></p>

            <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 12pt" align="center">&nbsp;</p>
        </div>

            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The following table sets forth certain unaudited selected consolidated financial information for each of the four quarters in fiscal 2009</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">and 2008. In management&rsquo;s opinion, this unaudited consolidated quarterly selected information has been prepared on the same basis as the audited consolidated financial
            statements and includes all necessary </font></font></font></p>
        </blockquote>

            <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 12pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b>ALANCO TECHNOLOGIES, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</b></font></p>
        </div>

        <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (continued)</font></b></font></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">adjustments, consisting only of normal recurring adjustments that management considers necessary for a fair presentation when read in conjunction with the consolidated financial statements and notes thereto.&nbsp; The Company believes these comparisons of consolidated quarterly selected financial data are not necessarily indicative of future
            performance.&nbsp;&nbsp;<strong>&nbsp;</strong> </font></font></p>
        </blockquote>

        <p></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'" size="2">Quarterly earnings per share may not total to the fiscal year earnings per share due to the weighted average number of shares outstanding at the end of each period reported.</font></font></p>
        </blockquote>

                <td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: medium none; BORDER-LEFT: medium none; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-LEFT: 0.07in; PADDING-RIGHT: 0.07in; BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; PADDING-TOP: 0in" valign="bottom" width="20"><font size="2">&nbsp;</font></td>

                    <p align="right"><font size="2">21,872,200</font></p>
                </td>

                <td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: medium none; BORDER-LEFT: medium none; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-LEFT: 0.07in; PADDING-RIGHT: 0.07in; BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; PADDING-TOP: 0in" valign="bottom" width="20"><font size="2">&nbsp;</font></td>

                    <p align="right"><font size="2">21,890,100</font></p>
                </td>

                <td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: medium none; BORDER-LEFT: medium none; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-LEFT: 0.07in; PADDING-RIGHT: 0.07in; BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; PADDING-TOP: 0in" valign="bottom" width="20"><font size="2">&nbsp;</font></td>

                    <p align="right"><font size="2">23,453,000</font></p>

        <p></p>

        <p>&nbsp;</p>

        <p><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><strong>18<font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">.</font></strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <b><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">SUBSEQUENT EVENTS</font></b></font></font></p>

        <p></p>

        <blockquote style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr">
            <p style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr" align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">The Company was</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">notified by Nasdaq on September 15, 2009 that the Company failed to comply with the minimum bid price of $1.00 per share requirement for continued listing as set forth in NASDAQ Marketplace Rule 4310 (c) (4) (the &ldquo;Rule&rdquo;). Therefore in accordance
            with the Rule, the Company will be provided 180 calendar days or until March 15, 2010, to regain compliance. If the bid price of the Company&rsquo;s common stock closes at $1.00 per share or more for a minimum of 10 consecutive trading days, NASDAQ Staff will provide written notification that it complies with the rule. If compliance with this Rule cannot be demonstrated by March 15, 2010, Staff will determine whether the Company meets the NASDAQ Smallcap Market initial listing
            criteria as set forth in Marketplace Rule 4310 (c), except for the bid price requirement. If it meets the initial listing criteria, Staff will notify the Company that it has been granted an additional 180 calendar days to meet the $1.00 minimum bid price requirement. If the Company is not eligible for an additional compliance period, Staff will provide written notification that the Company&rsquo;s securities will be delisted. At that time, the Company may appeal Staff&rsquo;s
            determination to delist it securities to a Listing Qualification Panel.</font></font></font></p>

            <p style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr"></p>

            <p style="MARGIN-RIGHT: 0px" dir="ltr" align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'"><font size="2"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">On September 15, 2009 the Company announced that it had completed a</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">financing with several independent accredited investors. The financing was comprised of the sale of 135,000 shares of convertible Series E Preferred Stock. The proceeds received by the Company from the
            offering was $541,000, net of approximately $62,000 in related expenses. The Series E shares accrue a 5% cash dividend and are convertible into twelve (12) shares of the Company&rsquo;s Class A Common Stock. The Powers, Preferences, Rights and Limitations of the Series E Preferred Stock were included as attachments to an 8-K filed September 17, 2009. See</font> <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Note 14 -</font>
            <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">Shareholders&rsquo; Equity the Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements for the fiscal year ended June 30, 2009 for additional discussion of the Series E Preferred Stock. </font></font></font></p>

            <p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; FONT-SIZE: 12pt" title="EE+ Page Footer" align="center"></p>
        </blockquote>

        <div style="MARGIN-TOP: 12pt" title="PAGENUM" align="center">
            <a name="PAGENUM"><font color="#000000" size="2" face="Times New Roman">50</font></a>
